Reviews.Title: “Short walk to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: pb201146172
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick weekend trip. The room was small but clean and everything was in working order. We really didn't even spend that much time in it. Every employee that we came in contact with was friendly and helpful. The wait for the elevator was a little long, one time we took the stairs down (only 8 floors) because it was taking too long. The walk to Times Square took 12 minutes. It was longer timewise to take a cab because of the traffic from the port authority that is across the street from the hotel. We headed out on foot in the morning and then took a taxi back at when we were done sight seeing. By that time our feet were tired. We need to go back to NYC because we did not get everything done that we wanted to. Would definetly consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice hotel for 1st time in New York”
Reviews.Author: Caroline M
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with this hotel! It's clean and modern, lovely bathrooms, comfy beds, good value and really easy access to everywhere, couldn't really be better for my first trip to New York! The complimentary breakfast is good too and the staff very helpful. Would recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again, glad I've still got a day left here just wish it was more!

Reviews.Title: “Undesirable location”
Reviews.Author: soccergirl123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Hells kitchen. You need to walk by the parole board . Chinese resturant, adult video and liquor store. Accross the street is the port authority. Definitely walk fast. Room are small. Breakfast was a zoo. It was free but poorly prepared and the area was a mess!!! The staff was nice and tried to help. If you can try another hotel. In NYC this is a value hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ian P
Reviews.Content: My first stay in the Big Apple was enhanced by the warm and friendly greeting by the wonderful reception staff at this conveniently located hotel - within walking distance of all the sights in Midtown Manhattan. There's a great fireplace in the lobby and free continental breakfast (which gets quite busy). The room was small but immaculate and comfy. On arriving - as soon as I unpacked I was able to see (all on foot) Times Square, Bryant Square, Grand Central Station, the Chrysler Bldg, get to the 102nd floor of the Empire State Bldg, Maceys and still be back in time to change for dinner! An excellent introduction to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lacking a few amenities”
Reviews.Author: jmills2
Reviews.Content: While I have been in NYC on several occassions, this was the first time I spent a full week as a tourist. This hotel is perfectly situation to enjoy the best of Manhattan and beyond. The property is clean, the front desk service was efficient and friendly, the rooms were smaller but adequate and well tended. Thus if you are simply looking for a great place to sleep within steps of Broadway, Shopping, Sprorts, and short subway rides to places like Yankee Stadium, Central Park, and Greenwich Village, you couldn't ask for a nice place. However, if you are seeking to make the hotel a part of your vacation, it's size and scope simply do not allow. On the first floor entry way is the breakfast area which is small and can be quite busy at certain times. It doubles as a "sports bar" at night but is never busy. There must be a dance club on the top roof because at night they reserve one elevator for traffic up and down and their was always a line of young people waiting to go up. The hotel has no pool, no spa, a fair wireless connection and very small spaces for exercise and such. Of course the city beckons, so it wasn't such a concern to me on this trip. I think it would be ideal for the business traveler, couples, friends and solo trips. Families who might necessary have to spend time in the hotel, might try somewhere else with more success. On the whole, I was pleased with my experiehnce.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: Idchic
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the price clean,good breakfast, staff friendly and helpful most of the time, street that it is located on can be a little uncomfortable at times.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother on March 25th 2012, a Sunday. I heard that the club on the roof is closed that day, so that must explain how QUIET the experience was! Very quick check in @ 7:30 pm. The bed is the best as far as comfort goes. Free breakfast is offered, with many choices. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Inn Good locations”
Reviews.Author: gt1950
Reviews.Content: Ok, the room was small and there was no bar or restaurant but free breakfast was more than I expected and everything was refilled very fast. The room was clean. But the staff! They were the BEST. Very very friendly and helpful. Good location. Easy walk to most places - We did had to walk down the block for a taxi. We go to NYC about 3 to four times a year will stay here again. Make sure they stamp your parking ticket you will save money.. One minus, Only one Elevator was working and there was a big rush at check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: jivkas
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC to see the Christmas decoration in the beginning of December 2011. Booked the Fairfield on Times Square and that was a great choice! The location is the best. It's in the middle of everything, right by Port Authority Station. So coming from JFK airport was perfect. We had a red eye flight coming from LA so we arrived in NY early morning. Decided to go to the hotel to drop our luggage at the front desk and go get breakfast somewhere as it was way to early for check-in. They actually had a room ready (high floor as I had requested) and let us check-in around 7am!! And invited as to get breakfast at the buffet (which is complementary - every morning). Room was not big, but very nice and clean. Breakfast buffet had juices, bagels, toasts, eggs, potatoes, sausage, coffee, tea, no pancakes though. So that was a very good start of the day for us :) And the we went to the room for a nap and later on went out around the city. Room was services when we came back in the evening! The hotel itself is not that big but contemporary, clean, and again the location is 10/10! They have a rooftop bar that unfortunately we could not visit as it was closed during our stay. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations, need better soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: JnAMcGhee
Reviews.Content: We made the trip to NYC to see the Macy's Day Parade and stayed at this location because of the proximity to the parade. It is your typical New York City hotel: contemporary and trendy in design, narrow hallways, and right on the border of everything you'd want to do in NYC. We were not impressed with the hotel staff. We stay in many hotels and the service at this particular location was not warm, nor was it friendly. When we visited the bar area to order food late on the night we first arrived, the gentleman in the bar was fabulously friendly (but there was a mix up with our bar tab--we paid cash that night for it and yet it ended up on our hotel bill and we STILL had to pay it again because the manager said once receipts from the bar were audited at the end of the month, they'd refund our money). We were awakened in the middle of the night by loud, laughing, obnoxious people who were, apparently, standing out in front of the elevators on our floor. It wasn't a snapshot of this noise, it went on for five minutes, ten minutes, and we were fed up enough to call the front desk to complain about the noise after 15 minutes. There are probably 10 rooms on a floor, maybe 15, but the small hallways make every noise very audible inside the rooms. The front desk associate acted as though our request to silence the noise outside of the elevators was uncalled for and as though WE were being an imposition by asking for assistance at 3 am. Within five minutes, the family in the room next to ours, with young children, were getting a strong, sturdy knock on their door telling them we (specifically mentioned our room number) had complained about noise from that room. Never did we mention our hotel neighbor as being noisy. We were the only two rooms at that corner of the hall! What a great reunion that next morning was when we all went to breakfast at the same time. A hotel associate's error could've made for a potentially heated moment. The room itself was nice (King size bed). The view was straight into a construction zone across the street. The included breakfast was probably the best thing they offered. Not really sure we'll stay at this location again. We seem to be in New York once a year or so and this will be the only time we will stay at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a week in march and enjoyed every minute off our stay”
Reviews.Author: Neilchilton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the beginning of march and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay . On arrival we were put on the 3rd floor but we asked to be moved to a higher floor with a good view , with no problem at all we were moved to the 29th floor with stunning views the next day . We found all the staff very polite and helpfull ( especially the bar tender and receptionist ) . Times square area is just 5 to ten mins walk away along with all the big name shops but also in the opposite direction (5 min walk again )is the hell's kitchen area with some superb bars and restaurants . Ideal place to stay for your first time visit , we will be going back here again !!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place!!”
Reviews.Author: kimike611
Reviews.Content: awesome staff, spotless room, great location!!! take dress shoes if you want to go to the skytop lounge!! will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: 393Sylvie
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in a hotel in Manhattan. I picked this hotel based on reviews, location and price and was not disappointed. The room was clean, staff courteous and helpful and the breakfast had lots of choices. Although the breakfast room was busy we found a table for the 3 of us both mornings. Our room was directly behind the elevator but we barely heard any noise from it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Pluses Outweigh the Minuses, Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: cindy8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights mid-week and had a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and helpful, the facilities spotlessly clean, and the location convenient even though it is on a seedy section of 40th St. It is sandwiched between two other nice hotels, though, so there are quite a few travelers walking that way so its not deserted. But, the area still might turn some people off as you have to walk by a sketchy liquor store and some peep shops to get to the hotel. But just look the other way because once you are in the hotel that disappears. The lobby is really slick with white marble floors and banquettes and chairs upholstered with a glam metallic sheen fabric. And there is a nice fireplace in the lobby too! The breakfast area in the back is also very nicely appointed and converts to a friendly bar at 5PM; lots of TV's to watch sports and news. We enjoyed the free wine and beer on the Tues. and Wed. nights we were there, and they put out food too. Granite counters in the bar and bathrooms are a nice updated touch. The breakfast in the morning was very busy but had everything you'd want; eggs, sausage, breakfast sandwiches, fruits, yogurts, juices, baked goods...the staff running it was really on the ball with the refills too. There is free coffee/tea/hot chocolate down there 24/7 too and everyone makes good use of that throughout the day. My overall impression of the way this hotel is run is that they know you might not stay there again if they don't get things right, (so many options!) so the staff are going out of their way to accommodate people. Great attitude! Our room was small but as I mentioned, very clean, and had a great view on the 27th floor. N ow here is a curious thing. On the top floor of the hotel there is a rooftop nightclub. So starting at 6PM one of the elevators is commandeered by serious looking bouncers and a velvet rope goes up cordoning off a section of the lobby as a coatroom and security check area for nightclub goers. This did not present a problem to us, it was just unusual. One night we did drop our teen off in our room and go up for a drink to check it out (no cover charge on Tuesday night!). It was not crowded at that time but still the folks at the club were very different that the businessman/tourist crowd who stays at the hotel! Being 50-somethings we felt a bit out of place but enjoyed our martinis (don't even want to know what they cost, my friend expensed them, but judging by the fact that in the casual "breakfast area bar" downstairs a martini is $21, I shudder to think). If you are staying there on a night when there is no cover charge and you can go up early before there's a line, I would definitely check this place out for the views are breathtaking with floor to ceiling glass in some areas. It is something to see. And if you are a club-goer type then this is really a great hotel for you to stay at because you'll be right there! But I digress from the hotel. I will absolutely stay there again. It is great value, great location, clean, near fun things, nice people. A favorite for the Times Square area., Though we took public transportation to the city, this hotel is also right across the street from Port Authority with the best deal on parking I've found in NYC so if you drive in check that out. I was torn about whether to give 4 or 5 stars because nothing is perfect and the location and tiny room thing are a bit of a drag. But because the price is so good, the location so convenient, and it is so clean and well-run, I gave it a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the Christmas break, and it was a wonderful property for $170/night for two double beds, which is quite good for Manhattan. Upon arriving, I parked at the off site parking next door and checked in. The lobby was well appointed, with a breakfast buffet at the back, which serves yogurt, bagels, fruit, and cereal, and coffee is available 24/7. The area gets VERY crowded after 8 am so I would advise going early, or getting the food and eating somewhere else. The rooms have comfortable beds, and are of adequate size, and have wired internet, which was OK, but wifi would have been better. Staff were attentive and friendly, and the night manager personally tried to correct a problem with the internet connection I was having in my room.

Reviews.Title: “STAY IN HIGHER FLOORS, DON´T BE LATE FOR BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: AndreSThiago
Reviews.Content: Small room no refrigerator no wifi in room while we were there(but if you see the site...) small breakfast area long wait 10th floor for the elevator smal lobby and weekend nights we have to share with the people goingo to the roof bar - we arriving wiht family pós dinner and "hot" girls sitting by the fireplace...Door safe damaged took 1 day to fix...Room not made 4 pm...Transfer SUV to JFK flat rate but the driver with angry face when I paid the amount guy on the lobby told me to. Noisy door 1007 when closes.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Hidden Gem with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dagsmith
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler - indeed I am Marriott Platinum - but I rarely comment when staying at a Courtyard or Fairfield Inn as they are all so similar. However, this hotel is a gem. 1. Great Location 2. Great service - more below 3. Usually a great price (I am sure it varies a bit seasonally) for NYC and this central location. 4. Nice size rooms. Not huge, but a little bigger than many NY hotels - especially at this price. I was here with three rooms (my family, my sister and my mother) and everything was great. We checked in at different times and had to check luggage and the bellman (wish I could remember his name) was a star. Checking in when my mom was waiting in the lobby, remembering names, giving directions. Truly better than I have seen at many a five star hotel. Unfortunately, my daughter had to be hospitalized that night. We called the front desk and 2 minutes later they had a doctor on the phone. The doctor gave us GREAT advice "If you call an ambulance you will go to an overcrowded hospital that gets most of the crime/worst incidents. Get a cab and go to NY Presbyterian." We called the front desk and mere minutes later the night manager was at our door with a wheelchair and when we got the lobby they had a cab waiting. On the elevator I pulled out some money for tips/taxi and then manager just looked at me and said "No - this is what we do - just get to the hospital." When we got back at 6am the next morning (my daughter okay) everybody greeted us and asked how we were. Great Location and Great Service at a Great Price. This is the place to stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property and Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several business trips and find the price and location a great deal. I usually fly into Newark and catch the train to Penn Station and take the E train and you find yourself within a few steps of the hotel entrance. Very easy for getting around the city. My only complaints are the elevators can take some time to get during busy hours and the lobby can become congested at times.

Reviews.Title: “close to everything”
Reviews.Author: BethlehemPaUSA
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, and close. We live in PA and take the bus into the city. There is a side door in the PABT that is across the street from the hotel, this is great when traveling with luggage. It is only a short safe walk to times square. The subway stop is at the corner. If it is raining you can walk underground to times square!

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise”
Reviews.Author: skiwithapro
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I only had to spend one night here The noise at night was too much. Street noise, hallway noise, doors slamming. Bad nights sleep. The hotel is close to Times Square and the theater district. Only good quality. The lobby is "stark" and cold. The staff looked and acted clueless. Anything other than a simple question and they had to consult someone else. I have stayed at the "Four Points" next door and had a much better all round experience. I will not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A proper gem literally 3mins walk off time square and broadway”
Reviews.Author: AdDonnelly
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews I was ready for a noisy box room in a rough location so I was truly delighted with the double room on the 23rd floor! Really roomy and a great shower! Really loved the iPod doc an plenty of sockets to recharge batteries for camera etc. The staff were all incredibly friendly. As for the sky bar well I was on the 23rd floor and never heard a thing, even on my first night when I was awake with jet lag! Thanks and will defo return next time I'm in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Not a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: MauricioBC
Reviews.Content: Not a good location at night! Rooms to small!! To expensive for what you get!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mastertraveler725
Reviews.Content: Had everything I needed. The breakfast was a great addition to the rate. New York is not cheap and having that amenity really helped. The staff at the front desk was very helpful as well!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: dansocal
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn - Times Square is a a gem in the heart of Manhattan. This property is much nicer than expected with extremely friendly staff. Everyone I encountered was there to offer help with enthusiasm. The lobby is nicer than most Fairfields and I never had a problem getting in even late at night. There is a separate door for the nightclub so you don't have to deal with that traffic. In the evening they also set aside one of the 3 elevators for the nightclub so sometimes you might have to wait for an elevator but it was never too excessive.The complimentary breakfast was about as expected with very good scrambled eggs but the sausage links were dried out. Coffee, Juices, yogurt, cereal and breads were all very good and the staff did a good at making sure items were refilled. The rooms might be on the small side but they were very well configured. Lots of drawers and a wardrobe to hang your clothes. There seemed to be plenty of outlets for plugging in electronics. Probably the best surprise was that each room has a fully functional AC/Heat that you can control. This is wonderful because with most NYC hotels you are stuck with a overheated room. The windows also opens a crack for fresh air. The rooms are clean and quiet and have a very modern bathroom. There are only 2 inconveniences to note. There is no wifi in the rooms so if you have an ipad or other wireless device you will have to go to the lobby to get internet and the ice machine is in the lower lobby which means you will have to go down there whenever you need ice. I think they could greatly improve the ice service by letting you pick up an ice bag at the front desk on your way into your hotel so you don't have to make two trips to the room. Just to note, there is a parole center on this street, but they only line up in the morning. I always felt safe in this area and don't feel this is a problem at all. The Port Authority bus center is right across the street. There is a Duane Reade and a Dean and Deluca nearby if you need sundries or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “A Fairfield Inn on steroids”
Reviews.Author: Luciana-Austin
Reviews.Content: I booked this Fairfield Inn with my Marriott points (I'm a Marriott Silver Elite and Marriott timeshare owner) and was a bit shocked that a Fairfield Inn would require so many points per day (everything in NYC is so expensive, of course). I have stayed in other Fairfield Inns across the country in the past and didn't expect this one to be so much nicer, but it was. I went to NYC for a travel blogging meet up, alone, and I don't usually travel alone, so this was a new experience to me. The location wasn't really the greatest in my opinion, too far west and too close to Times Square for my taste, near a Parole office, didn't feel that safe but I'm paranoid about these things. The hotel was going through some renovations in the lobby and the fact that its entrance is shared with the Sky Room, which is accessible to the general public, made it a bit confusing (I had to show I was a hotel guest to get in every night to bypass the queue for the Sky Room). The room was definitely a much nicer room than I expected from a Fairfield Inn, fairly new, much better decorated than any other Fairfield Inn I've been to (meaning = it tried to be nice versus just plain simple), good bathroom (also very new), decent size for NYC, it was a nice surprise. It was quiet (elite floor), very comfortable bed, I had a complaint on the first night about some hair in a towel, but after that everything was very clean. Breakfast at the Sky Room was OK, they had a decent selection for a complimentary breakfast but in a weird seating arrangement, with a very nice view. I enjoyed my stay, still think all hotel prices in NYC are insane, and am glad I stayed here for free. This is definitely a better Fairfield Inn than most, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: TSUAGD
Reviews.Content: Husband and I traveled to NYC for a long weekend and chose this hotel specifically because it was a Marriott property and was located within close walking distance (3 blocks) to the Jacob Javits center (we were attending an event there). We had no problems with cab driver finding the location. Check in was quick, and our room was ready to check in at 10:30 am- very unexpected. We anticipated having to check our bags with the concierge, which was an available service. We may have received a priority treatment on room availability because we have Marriott Gold status and they sent us an email the day before asking when we were going to be there. Regardless, we were pleased they could accomodate. The hotel has a small but very updated and modern lobby area which makes a good impression. It was snowy and rainy while we were there, and someone was continually mopping and drying the floor. In the evening, half of the lobby doubles as the queue for the SkyBar on the top level of the hotel. Our room was on the 27th floor, one king bed. The room was small, but typical for NYC standards. It was clean and well equipped and everything was in good repair. Amenities include in room safe, Starbucks coffee to brew in the room, good bedside reading lamps, desk and workstation, typical bathroom amenities, nice fluffy white towels. We had a great city view from our room. The only complaint was an extra sitting chair that was way too big, not necessary and completely in the way. My spouse could barely get out of his side of the bed because the chair and the side table took up so much room. But that was a small thing, really. Might also be a tight fit if you are traveling with several large suitcases. Because the hotel was in close proximity to many restaurants, we didn't eat at the hotel free breakfast. You will not have to search too far for any type of food that you might want to eat. The hotel is a two block walk to times square, there is a subway entrance right on the corner, and the bus terminal is directly across the street so transportation options are plentiful. We paid $169 per night for this hotel and were very pleased with the price and quality considering the location. This was a great value and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property near Times Square! Good value!”
Reviews.Author: BigDaveB10
Reviews.Content: Nice, 3 star hotel convenient to Times Square, Penn Station and the bus terminal. Rooms are small but clean, big desk and flat screen hotel. I love this place as a business property being relatively close to my company's showroom and for getting around NYC and beyond. Thirty-two floors x 8 rooms per floor all close to the elevator but no elevator noise! This property has a lot of group activity so the free breakfast is a mob scene most mornings so hang a right out of the hotel, go up one block, cross the street and get a real breakfast if you want one at Teleon Cafe. Also, there is a roof top lounge that must be pretty nice (Sky Room) as every night I come back there is a "Saturday Night Fever" crowd waiting in line to go up. Also, the black bouncer guys are not real friendly and act like they're working the door at the Viper Room. Whatever. Still a very nice property overall.....I have already booked another stay for the end of next month.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: rev217_chino
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm biased, but staying here in Sep 2010, after travelling for a year in 3rd world countries, this hotel was the bomb diggidy. Climate controlled rooms, tv, phone, window with a view, bed, linens, mattress, carpeted floor, washroom with hot water, bath tub, toilet paper, 110V electricity, mirror, wall paper, and no bugs! (I'm told most of these are in most hotels.) The staff are courteous, and the hotel is on a slightly smelly street (maybe it was garbage day), but the overall location is close enough to all the main NYC attractions without having tons of ppl walk by all day and night. There is a small gym with some weights and treadmill which I never used, among some other if you're dying to impress the ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up with a big smile on my face”
Reviews.Author: Nikkicee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what I expected based on the negative review. The staff was extremely helpful, courteous, and friendly.People if u give attitude and rude to the staff I really don't blame them for being rude to u. The club, the Sky Room, was fantastic u can drink as much as u want , dance n take the elevator down to ur room. The continental breakfast has a nice selection. U can bring the food back to ur room if u feel the breakfast room was too crowed. Everything was walking distance from the hotel (not recommended for the cold months). The room was udated and a good size. The complementary cookies are fantastic goes great with a glass of milk or Bailey's. Bottom line this gets two thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Great Service But Beware Nightclub Noise”
Reviews.Author: JLTravels
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 nights. The location is literally across the street from Port Authority just outside Times Square. It sits in a little cluster of hotels. There is a parole office on the next block, if you care about that sort of thing. The service was competent and efficient. Everyone was friendly and professional. The breakfast was crowded, but decent. The room was small (yes, even for NYC) but we managed it with children and many many pieces of luggage. Housekeeping was above average--our room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel has a nice urban stylish feel to it. My major complaint is the noise. There is a NIGHTCLUB on the top floor. We were on the 27th floor and I didn't hear anything until our 4th night (Thursday) and then it was extremely loud from around 11pm until 2am or so. I do tend to be on the noise sensitive side...it's just not possible for me to fall asleep when I can hear house music pounding away. We did have an ok view, but I wouldn't trade it for a night's sleep next time. If you aren't bothered by that sort of thing (or if you are on a lower floor), this is a fine value-oriented place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for accomodations in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Road_Maven
Reviews.Content: We live nearby and occasionally stay in Manhattan to see a couple of shows, a museum or two and have a nice dinner. We prefer stay in the theatre distict.The room rates are quite expensive but if you shop well, you can find a bargain. The Fairfield Inn is on the cusp of the theatre district between 8th and 9th Avenune. Since we frequent Marriott hotels, this was a no brainer. We checked in at 11 AM on Saturday. If they didn't have a room available we could have checked our grip and be on our way. Room was small but normal for Manhattan. (We've stayed in some really small rooms in Manhattan but lets face it, you're here for the sights. You sleep in your room). The room was laid out well with everything you needed. Bedding was fine. The room was clean. The bathroom is small with a nice glass enclosed shower instead of a bath tub. The door to the bathroom has milk glass but is fine unelss you are extremely modest. This wasn't an issue at all. Towels were nice and fluffy for a Fairfield Inn. Elevators were a tad slow but again, this is NY. Our 31st floor room had a view of the Empire State Building if you leaned to the right. Again, this is NY with lots of tall buildings. In any hotel, you usually get a view of a building across the street or an air shaft. It's just the way it is in Manhattan. Breakfast was fine. In fact better than the usual Fairfield Inn breakfasts you find in other hotels. As for food, there is no restaurant in the hotel since Fairfield Inn's don't have restaurants but you won't go hungry. You are a couple of short blocks to the theatre district and restaurant row. However, my wife and I go to 9th Avenue and walk north where there are dozens of restaurants of every ethincity including Thai, Indian, Turkish, Italian, Greek, French and the list goes on. This is where the New Yorkers eat. You won't go wrong here. Face it. You didn't come to New York to eat in Applebys or Baba Gumps. As for location, you next to the Port Authority Bus Terminal, and a half a block from the 42nd St subway station. We came by public transportation but if you come by car they have a deal with a parking garage two doors away for around $28 for 24 hours. In this part of Manhattan, the norm is at least $40 and no garage offers in and out privliges. Remember, this is New York and not Omaha. Besides, if you go anywhere in Manhattan you use public transportation or a cab as there is no place to park. Their breakfast room doubles as a bar after 5 PM that has all the appeal of an institution. If you want to have a cocktail before going out to dinner, take a walk and find your new favorite place and skip this place. We'll be back in a few weeks. You won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: wxgirl_11
Reviews.Content: The bartender in the onsite bar was excellent!! My boyfriend and I arrived just before the complimentary happy hour and couldn't have been more surprised! He was very attentive and super friendly. He made us feel like celebrities! The only downfall was the lack of a restaurant. There is a menu, but the food is delivered from next door. It takes FOREVER. We waited over an hour! You're better off going to the bar for drinks and grabbing dinner someplace else. We stayed for one night after attending a concert at Roseland, and it couldn't have been more convenient! The breakfast in the morning was also excellent. Great selection for a free breakfast. Very pleased :) The room itself was not too fancy... I was disappointed that we did not have a mini fridge (make sure you eat your whole meal!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, small room”
Reviews.Author: Wrestling-Online
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right next to Times Square so basically you go out, walk two blocks up and you're in the middle of all the New York madness. It's a nice hotel, with great staff and clean environment however the room was too small for two people with two suitcases. We barely had space to roam. The breakfast area is also impossible to go in as it is too small for that amount of people. Complimentary breakfast is a big plus and so is the free Internet. Overall it's a great hotel and wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average New York City hotel, fair priced accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Wailym
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this Faifield, for one night one new years day. It held up to everything it promises; Easy check in, clean comfy rooms, friendly staff, free hot breakfast, smooth check out at noon. We had no issues during our stay outside of normal policies. However, we have been Marriott rewards members for over 7 years, and made a few requests before check in. We had requested early check in for a standard double room, on a high floor, and in the corner facing away from street. We were not granted any of the above. We attempted to check in at noon, and were told only king rooms available. I left a cell number, at their request, to be called when ready. At 2pm I called the front desk and still nothing available. At 3:15 we walked back in and there was a room available, but never received a call, and I doubt we would have. Early check in is not guaranteed, but we have received better attention elsewhere. We traveled with my mother who had knee surgery and cannot stand or walk for long periods. Parking is not as bad as it seems, for the city. The lot is really right next door but does service the other two hotels on street, which are all right next to each other. And there is no in and out service. Parking is not free, hotel will validate for a discount, we paid $28 for 24 hours. The room was comfy as expected by Marriott but small. Just enough room for furniture, no room to leave anything out. Bathroom is tiny, but has everything you need. Walk in glass shower, great hot water and pressure. The bathroom door itself is made with opaque glass that's really kind of see through. You can definitely see inside if standing by door! And bath is right when you walk in to your room, so again no real space at all. But keep in mind, it is NY and for that fact the room is more than adequate. We were on the 10th floor, and could still hear the streets below. Not enough to keep you awake. We had a very small window facing the bus terminal across the street. Location of this hotel is very convenient to times square area. Walk a few blocks and you are in the middle of it all. The street location of hotel is pretty bare and ugly. Feels like it's on a side alley, mainly because of bus terminal. There are a few restaurants nearby, chines, pizza. And a pharmacy on corner. Oh, the sky room bar was not open, closed Sunday and Monday, so we did not experience. The bar lounge area, which also hosts breakfast, was open. We peeked inside to see a small bar,one bartender but plenty of room to sit for some drinks. Breakfast the next morning was until 10am. They served hot scrambled eggs, sausage, cereals, bagels, juices, microwaved sandwiches ect. Pretty good, but very busy of course. The staff was attentive and courteous. Overall, our stay was comfortable and met it's needs. I would only prefer they paid more attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: aylaj
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is awesome! Way more than any other hotel I have been to. Breakfast is well worth waking up for. (If you can't find a seat for breakfast just bring the food up to your room) The lounge is calming with a wonderful fire. The front desk people were alright (not rude) just lacking in friendliness but every other staff member were very kind and charismatic. The elevator wasn't slow at all for me and I thought the TV in the elevator was cute. The rooms were a nice size. I had stayed at the double tree in the middle of time square the weekend before and honestly, everything about this hotel was better. Beds were better, bathrooms nicer, lounge WAY better. I wish I could tel you about the sky bar but I fell asleep on the comfy bed and didn't make it lol. BUT I saw a line outside and inside the hotel of trendy people waiting to get into the sky bar. If you are staying there don't worry about the line. This location is a couple blocks to the side of time square but its located around useful restaurants and practical stores. I will totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jasonmcgarr
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really nice. Our room was 3001. It was very big and clean. Everything looked new and worked great. The shower was hot and the pressure was very good. The bed was perfect. They have an Ipod doc and radio, a flat screen TV and free wired internet in the room. There was a coffee maker with free coffee and a few bottles of free water. The elevator was quick quick quick! Hardly any noise outside and none in the hallway. There are only 8 rooms per floor. Ice and vending is only on the first floor. The have a small bar on the 1st floor and a pretty hip club on the roof. The hotel is 4 blocks off of Times Square. It was a real easy walk. There are alot of good small spots to eat just to the west of the hotel on 7th Ave. Breakfast was included in my rate. It was Contenental Plus with scrambled eggs, sausage, bagles, muffins, english muffine, microwavable breakfast sandwiches, coffee, 3 different juices. Pretty nice. That runs until 10am. It was my anniversary and they left a nice card and bottle of wine gartis in my room. The front desk supervisor Colleen called me and offered me tickets to Wicked that one of the other guests had to give up for the night. It was really nice that she thought of us. Great experience. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. My rate for 2 nights was: 12/16/11 ROOM CHARGE RP3001 297.00 12/16/11 Occupancy Tax T13001 11.88 12/16/11 City Sales Tax T43001 14.48 12/16/11 City Tax T33001 17.45 And my 3rd night was: 12/18/11 ROOM CHARGE RP3001 178.00 12/18/11 Occupancy Tax T13001 7.12 12/18/11 City Sales Tax T43001 8.68 12/18/11 City Tax T33001 10.46 12/18/11 Convention and Tourism Tax T53001 3.50

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fr3houston
Reviews.Content: What was good: The location is great if you want to be near Times Square, it was just a few minutes away. The room was generally clean and a really decent size The staff was friendly and helpful What it lacked: The hotel doesn't offer WIFI in the rooms, only in public areas. The wired internet can be a huge inconvenience, and of course - for those of us with tablets, it's useless. I was unfortunate enough to require a rental car during this trip, which of course should be avoided at all costs in Manhattan. But it would have been nice if the hotel had its own valet or parking garage, versus having to park two doors down at a random garage. Can't imagine many people with this, but it was a negative.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good, but Location is better!”
Reviews.Author: chickenfarmer22
Reviews.Content: Located a rock's throw away from Times Square. Stayed on 9th floor and the room was small, but pretty big for New York. Exceptionally nice bathroom and very clean. Good selection of food for breakfast. I especially liked the microwavable sandwiches. Liked the atmosphere and setting of the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MarthaJoJo
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I think you will be hard pressed to find better value. Clean, modern and really central. Get up early for breakfast though, gets busy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and food tips”
Reviews.Author: jogar1
Reviews.Content: Considering the location, prices for this hotel are pretty good. It's classy, has great service, and a free breakfast, which includes sausage, eggs, bagels, muffins, eggers, cereal, yogurt, coffee, juice, free food is unheard of in NY. The hotel looks very new,and very clean. Quiet at night. Yes rooms are smaller, but adequate, you're in Times Square! Streets in NY, come on, it's NY! of course there will be homeless etc. get over it. If every little thing of a big city bugs you...stay home. The streets are safe..cops are everywhere, especially at night. Highly recomend Juiniors, Tic Toc Diner, great food, large servings and good price. Lots of good little delis everywhere too,. AppleBees is expensive and small portions. Only eat at restaurants with an "A" in the window. B, C or pending review..run. Took a 48hr all loops Hop On Hop Off with GreyLines Tours. Do it! You see so much, the guides are very informative. You can hop off at many different stops in the city and catch another one when you're ready. We booked through AMA, better prices. Streets and stores are very busy, it's Christmas in NY! Take good shoes, have fun, and go with the flow..you're in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Xmas in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Rodger K
Reviews.Content: I took a reccommendation from a friend about the Fairfield Inn & Suites in NY. I was looking for a great price, great location hotel. I found it! The rates are high in NYC for the holidays. I was up for just one night to go out to the theatre. This hotel has a FANTASTIC Sunday night rate. We were able to check in early. They offered complimentary coffee, tea, flavored water 24 hrs a day and cookies at night. There was a small but very nice breakfast offered at no additional charge. The staff was EXTREMELY nice and quite helpful. The room was small, but very clean and had a large walk-in glass shower. I highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: katakam
Reviews.Content: its a great experience, rates are fine, very class and neat rooms. good service. provided good information about city and tourist places, very comfortable beds. prime location and very near to shopping. excellent room service, very good breakfast and food.

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMoncton
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Fairfield for 4 nights. The room was clean and had everything we needed. Sure the rooms are on the smaller side, but were certainly acceptable. The top thing for us was the location of the Fairfield. 5 mins. to Times Square, 15 mins. to Rockerfeller, Hell's Kitchen right around the corner. Almost everything we wanted to see and experience was within walking distance. The front desk staff were very helpful and everyone we encountered at the Fairfield was friendly. The breakfast was great. We were on the 3rd floor overlooking the Port Authority and did not have any trouble sleeping. Felt very safe in this neighbourhood. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay if you have an early am flight from JFK”
Reviews.Author: Dave9988
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Good Place to stay prior to a flight. Front desk staff very courteous. Rooms are standard FI rooms. Our room had a flat screen TV. They have breakfast out and ready by 430am (self service) which is a nice touch for early departures. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business (last minute trip) and was actually booked right next door at the Four Points Sheraton. I usually stay closer to 54th street and Central Park, but there was limited vacancy in Midtown. When I arrived, Four Points was overbooked so they sent me next door to the Fairfield. As it turns out, Four Points actually picked up my tab (so the night was free)! Kudos to Starwood. This is really a review of Fairfield Inn, though. As some of the other reviews indicate, the area west of Times Square is a little bit edgy-er compared to the areas closer to Central Park (but the hotels near Central Park are MUCH more expensive). I was pleasantly surprised at the value of the Fairfield in. The location is not an issue. It's actually about 2 blocks from the theaters and Times Square. It was a little bit of a walk up to work (1.5 miles). For me, a runner, no issue. The only issue to consider is that a cab from LaGuardia would have to cross MidTown to the west side (a little longer trip). This hotel is not large - very small lobby. But that really doesn't matter to me. (The Hilton MidTown Mahattan has a big lobby but it is a terrible hotel.)The hotel staff was efficient and professional and even called me up in my room to see how things were. The room was nicely appointed. Great HDTV. Tiled bathroom. Extremely clean. No wifi, but free internet via the LAN cord. In the morning, I took advantage of the free breakfast of cereal, bagels, fruit, coffee. A nice perk. I would highly recommend staying here as well as the Four Points. For the money, you are close to everything and the hotels are both of nice quality. It's not necessary to spend huge sums on hotels, especially if you only sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good considering.....”
Reviews.Author: PatinCO
Reviews.Content: Wife and I and adult daughter had a 2-double bed room Dec 2 - Dec 7, 2011. The first thing to talk about is the staff. They were really good. Quick check-in and quick check-out. They were all very helpful, especially Jason the doorman. Great restaurant suggestions, and excellent help with luggage. The location isn't bad, 3 blocks from Times Square, and only 15 mins from Rockerfeller Center. Cabs are not difficult to find and the subway is one block away and it goes everywhere. Yeah the are two adult video stores and the State Parole Office to pass on the way to 8th avenue, but there was never any bother and we felt safe even at 1:30 am on Saturday night. The only time was heard the nightclub on the 33rd floor was when we went up there the first night. Very loud music and a 20-30s something scene. Didn't go back up there during the trip. Not our style. My one complaint about the hotel is the price of drinks at the bar on the first floor that is the breakfast location in the mornings. Sunday evening my wife and I stopped in for a drink and she had two Vodka Gimlets, which is just a shot of Vodka and a shot of lime juice. Each was was $14. $14!!!!!! I know things are more expensive in this area and I expect to pay more for things, but to charge the price a of full bottle of Vodka for each shot, thats some markup. The next night, we went in again and were only charged $10 per drink. The bartender that night said that the previous bartender was wrong. I complained at the front desk, and was told the next day that the first was tender was correct and the the second time were had not been charged for the lime juice, just the Vodka. Never hear of that before. Mixers aren't charged separately. Enough about that already. Overall, I think the hotel was great. I wouldn't consider the rooms "spacious" especially for 3 adults, but we made do.l If one is sitting at the desk, they would have to move for another to get to the other side of the room. Tiny bathroom. Reminded us of bathrooms in Paris. Again, the best parts of the hotel are its location and the staff. Good beds, good linens, good bath towels and washcloths. Breakfast was a treat because its so expensive everywhere else in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Super-fine staff and hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: calendargirl60
Reviews.Content: I cannot sing enough praises for all the staff at this hotel....everyone went out of their way to make our stay great. Had never stayed in NY before and was a little skeptical if had chosen the right place. I was certainly delighted. Daniel, the mgr., was extremely gracious, friendly and helpful in all ways. He made stay at this hotel the best ever. Will certainly be going back here for another stay. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my trip!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevinpica
Reviews.Content: This hotel destroyed my stay in Manhattan! I was unable to check in before dinner time. The lobby is very small for a chain hotel and could not accommodate the quests. My room was not ready at 4:30 PM. The hotel is loud due to a night club on the roof. Expect a lot of hall noise! The manager was rude and would not listen to me. I have called customer service for Marriott and complained about this horrible hotel! Trust me...I stay at Marriott a lot. This place is a mess and totally disorganized!

Reviews.Title: “really nice oasis on a yukky street!”
Reviews.Author: wanderer69_9
Reviews.Content: just spent two nights at this marriott property using points....staff was very friendly and helpful in every way...front desk to brkfst room where yvette was so attentive and helpful..brksfst included was a big help although room was a bit crowded it made use of every available inch of space as has to be done in nyc...my room (2602) had a nice city view and was very attractively appointed...clean in every way...the king bed was not very comfotable though as appeared an extremely overweight person had slept on one side more than once and made one side of the bed sag...mattress needed replacing...a chaise lounge in the small room would be adequate for a child to sleep on...location is center city and easily accessible to many sights although the street is cluttered with debris and includes a couple of xx video stores and the state pardons/parole office which in itself was not a problem. times square subway stop is at corner as are a couple of good eateries..dean and deluca and schweppies kitchen or something like that...would stay there again even if not using points for stay...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Quilting4Cats
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business. Room was clean and comfortable and the front desk was very pleasant and helpful. About a 15 minute walk to NY Public Library and 5th Avenue shops. About 20 minute walk to Rockefeller Center. Times Square is about 5 minutes. I felt very safe walking back to the hotel around 7 pm on on a Sunday evening. The other reviewers are correct in that there are a few adult book/video stores on the street, but they did not have any window displays or anyone hanging around handing out literature like there are in Times Square. The breakfast area was very nice and well stocked with a variety of egg sandwiches, cereals, bagels, oatmeal, fruit, etc. Hot coffee/tea is available in the breakfast area 24/7. The best amenity of the hotel is the free internet although it was only available via Ethernet hook up in the room (not wireless) and therefore I needed to remain at the desk instead of using the computer on the bed, but none the less, it worked great and was not an extra charge. My only complaint (more of a city complaint) is that the taxi's do not like to go down (up?) West 40th street. Upon arrival, I was dropped off at the corner of 8th & 40th and told to walk a few buildings down to the hotel. I needed a taxi in the morning, and the bellman tried like heck to flag down a taxi for me and none would stop! I ended up walking up to the bus station and getting in the line for the taxi stand there. I would definitely stay here again. A few weeks ago I was in NY for business and stayed at the Hilton Times Square. For half the cost, the Fairfield Inn & Suites, by far, succeeded the Hilton in every way - except one - and that was room size...but who stays in their room when in New York City anyway? I needed to find a less costly hotel and picked this one from the reviews on TripAdvisor. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great cheaper alternative in the Big Apple.”
Reviews.Author: moffica
Reviews.Content: This is a super hotel. Staff were great, very friendly and super helpful. Our room was on a high floor with a good city view. The room was spacious, very clean and to be honest a pleasure to be in. We got a great rate of $185 a night and for this price it’s the best in the city. We stayed 4 nights in the 5 star Jumeriah Essex House then transferred here for our final two nights (Essex House room rates jumped to $1800 a night which is why we stayed here). I was nervous coming from the luxury of the Essex house, but as soon I spoke to the staff and saw the room I was delighted. The bathroom was nice and clean and I would have been happy staying here for the full stay. Some have mentioned the area, it fine seriously. The bus station entrance is not on the street, if you weren’t looking for the two seedy stores you wouldn’t notice them, it’s a short walk up to a main street and time square its honestly fine and we returned late at night and felt perfectly safe and if I could get the same rate would stay again, no problem. We also visited the Sky Bar, it is a little pretentious for what it is, view is nice, drinks are poorly made and way overpriced for what you get, on a positive our waitress was great, super friendly, polite and chatty. We stayed for a couple of hours but to be honest, go up, get a drink, take in the view and go somewhere else, it lacked atmosphere and the people think they should be on the cover of some fashion magazine, it’s a bar on top of a 3 star hotel!! This bar is so far apart from what you experience in the hotel, go and visit the hotel, its great only go to the bar if you have a spare hour and a loose $70.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JonRobert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days, and I had great stay. The front desk was very helpful, kind, and they remembered me. I left my phone charger at home and the Front Desk Manager gave me one to keep. I never made it to breakfast, but the area was always clean and well kept. Bill Marriott would be proud that his name is on the building.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jomomma8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends for a "girls week" in NYC. We found the hotel to be very clean and the staff to be extremely helpful. One of the gals dropped an earring down the drain by mistake and someone was there within 15 minutes to retreive it for her....and with a smile! The front desk staff and concierge were all extremely helpful with questions and directions. Breakfast area (which becomes the bar in the evening) was small, but worked out fine. Food was good, and variety was ok. They were constantly refilling things that were running out and there was always plenty of food and beverage! Location is pretty good, even though it's next to the Parole Office. We walked everywhere and never felt unsafe. Very close to the subway, which is also a big plus. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be close to the Theatre District and Times Square, but wanting to pay a little less for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “great deal at a clean hotel new hotel”
Reviews.Author: spankyfinch
Reviews.Content: +Breakfast was included and while the service area was small the quailty was good +The location is a tiny bit sketchy, including the walk past the parole office, we didnt have a problem +room was clean and new +we paid with (CAA/AAA) two hundred-ish a nite +On the corner of 9th and 40th there is some yummy one dollar 24h pizza -elevators were slow and crowded

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: MMG807
Reviews.Content: NYC hotel rooms are expensive, there's no getting around that! In addition to being mere minutes from Times Square, you are walking distance to The Empire State Building, Macy's and all the shows the Fairfield Inn and Suites is very much a value added option. Free breakfast served in the lobby is a top notch with lots to choose from - a good variety of toast, cereal, fresh fruit as well as fruit cups, pastries, yogurt, juice and Starbucks coffee. In addition to saving you the money of eating breakfast out, it saves you the time of finding a restaurant, ordering, and being served leaving more time to see the fabulous city! Yes, the rooms are small but very clean and modern - don't waste time in the room there's too much to do!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kcanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed here for 4 nights in October on departing from a cruise. The hotel is in an excellent location close to Times Square, actually it is very central to everything, situated across the road facing the rear of the NY Port Authority building. We found walking to the hotel from 8th Ave the better choice than 9th Ave which appeared grubby and seedier. The subway is easy to use to get around but we preferred walking for the New york experience. The receptionist was somewhat stand offish when we initially booked in. Our room was quite spacious and clean,we were on the inside of the building which made it quiet but not much of a view.The sink in the bathroom came without a plug and you just walked directly into the shower with only the shower curtain to stop water from going all over the floor,the shower nozzle would spray water out the back of it.Holding it in a certain position with a hand would alleviate the problem.Considering the hotel is supposed to be only about 3 years old this seems pretty sloppy. Breakfast was a frenetic affair and we did not find the choices to our liking but as it was included we made the most of it. All in all,I would recommend it for a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent option close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: rppedrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two young kids (ages 6 and 4) on a trip to see Mary Poppins. It is a bit confusing to find the entrance to the NY Port Authority parking garage that is across the street (not the hotel's problem - just something to note if you are driving into the city. The location of the hotel is not the greatest. It is close to Times Square, but the walk to get there takes you past some pretty seedy buildings, parking lots, and adult video stores. Not the greatest for families. The hotel itself was very clean inside. The rooms were clean and decent size for the city. The continental breakfast was pretty decent. I found the staff to be way nicer and much more welcoming than I remember from other NYC hotels. Bottom line, I would definitely consider staying here again, so long as the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: citygirl515
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic trip in New York with my daughter for her 21st Birthday. The hotel was clean and room extremely comfortable. It was cleaned everyday with fresh towels and bed re-made with mints on the pillow...nice touch after a full days sightseeing just to get into bed. The bed was huge. We didn't have a great view but what we lost on views we made up with a quiet nights sleep. Sheer bliss. The breakfast was more than adequate and we didn't have any trouble finding a table but we were down there by 8am. The location was brilliant right in the heart of it all and navigating your way around is easy. All in all a brilliant first trip to the USA and can't wait to go again. Do not miss the sky bar if just for the views awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for the private car”
Reviews.Author: SKing550
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice enough. Our only problem was being locked out of our room when we had requested (and received) a late check out....so be sure to check at the desk that your key card still works before heading back up to your room. Also, we were advised by the "bell man" that renting the hotel's private car to take us back to LGA was cheaper (at $51.00) than taking a cab...."due to the extra fees involved". We waited for the "private car" long enough and ended up taking a taxi anyway. The fare? $30.20 add to that a generous tip!

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again !!!”
Reviews.Author: schmupergirl
Reviews.Content: Location was awesome and within walking distance to the subway and Times Square. We walked, comfortably, to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, Hell's Kitchen, etc. Our room was very clean with an updated bathroom. We had everything we needed from an iron, ironing board, hair dryer, plenty of towels, television, heat/ac. Front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. Highly recommend going to the rooftop bar. Downstairs bartender, Jake, was AWESOME! Hotel linked us up with an affordable car service back to the airport. Housekeeping was very congenial and brought us extra towels when requested. Free breakfast was really good despite the limited seating. We had no difficulty enjoying our breakfast and liked the ability to eat and get out on the town. We will stay here again for future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but NY size of rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dianne92
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my family last week. Excellent small hotel, although neighbourhood could be better, as it is right across NY Port Authority bus terminal... Breakfast ok, but very unfriendly waiters and not clean. Rooms excellent, small but very clean and well equipped. Front desk was very helpful with finding our lost Broadway tickets!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: hangdog
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms (a good deal with Marriott Rewards points) last weekend. I was bringing my son and a friend to Comic Con which was at the nearby Javitts Center. I was pleasantly surprised at how close this was to Times Square. Less than a 5 minute walk yet away from the hustle and bustle. My room was on the back side of the hotel and it was so quiet you could hear a pin drop - absolutely no noise whatsoever. My son and his friend stayed just a few doors down but facing 40th Street (across from Port Authority) and although they hear some sirens during the night, it was a quiet night overall for them, too. Much better than other NYC hotels I have stayed in where I haven't slept a wink! The front desk staff was so helpful. We arrived early and they took my cell to call me when our rooms were ready. We needed a refrigerator for medical supplies and it was there when we arrived. The room was very clean and spacious by NYC standards. Perhaps one of the biggest surprises was the free breakfast. I expected standard light continental breakfast that most hotels offer - but wow! Starbucks Coffee, and delicious bacon, egg & cheese sandwiches on a biscuit or sausage egg and cheese on a bagel. Just pop it in one of the provided microwaves and you were set. Surprisingly good! I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel convenient to all, yet slightly off the main drag and away from all the craziness that is NYC. I'm already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Luxe & Location!”
Reviews.Author: mynamemeanslife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept 28-Oct 2, friendly staff, luxurious room, awesome bars up top, views are great, lovely decor, clean, great location by times square/42nd port authority(subway line) the continental breakfast is amazing! STARBUCKS COFFEE! :D

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the big apple”
Reviews.Author: klmofo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb position for all the sites of New York Stayed here in October 2010 its not one of the biggest hotels by any means But it has all the mod cons that you would expect from this hotel chain The breakfast is more than adequate but get there early as the setting area fills up very fast But do as we did and use the front bar for extra space if you need it Roof top bar is one of the tallest in New York but very expensive $8 for a bottle of Bud Rooms are very comfy and only about six to a floor so quite and very clean and modern Super market just on the end of the block so handy for some cheap beer and wine The street dose appear to be a bit tacky but we had no problems And return late on most nights

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: victoria_and_albert3
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff were very helpful throughout our three night stay. Close to Times Square, subway etc. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the wifi in the lobby area. Free tea and coffee in lobby 24/7. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Compact - and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hemingray55
Reviews.Content: We can't afford the Ritz, but wanted something decent and comfortable and this hotel delivers. Great staff and customer service go along with. There are some shortcomings, but it's a result of being in the big city. For instance, to get ice, you have to go all the way to the "lower lobby", a.k.a. basement. It's just a function of a very slim building (there are several hotels in this block that are the same way) and if you ask for a plastic bag at the lobby as you pass through, you can grab some ice and then head up to your room. The rooms are very compact, but plenty comfortable and well appointed. Again, this is a function of being in NYC and we were prepared for it. It was surprisingly quiet in the room the sounds of the city rarely penetrated - even with a building under construction on the next block over. I am comfortable navigating large cities, but the area can be a little intimidating for some people. The NY Port Authority bus terminal is across the street, so it gets a little seedy at times (oh, and the NY State Parole Office is something you'll pass on the walk to Times Square) In either case, it's mostly people just hanging out and nobody bothered us on any walk. There are plenty of food choices within just a few blocks, and the heart of Times Square and the theater district are both just a short walk away. Ditto for the Times Square/42 St. subway station, so you are close to transportation. Penn Station is a little further but doable unless you're carting luggage - might as well spring for the short cab ride. All in all, we liked this hotel a lot and would easily return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing location & friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Reese6
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (we're in our 30's) brought my parents (both 55) to NYC for a early 30th anniversary gift on Sept 22-25. The hotel was very modern, clean and our 11th floor room with 2 double beds was big enough for 4 of us to stay for 3 nights - we didn't find it noisy at all. We didn't take advantage of the continental breakfast each day but we did use the 24 hr coffee/tea station in the lobby which was handy. We also appreciated the 3 computers on the lobby level to print out Yankees tickets as well as our boarding passes. The location was amazing. We took a taxi to and from the airport but the bus terminal is right across the street. And it's a short walk to the subway, Times Sq and all sites and restaurants. After reading many reviews to check out the 2 Bros pizza, we went there twice for after-bar food. You can't beat $1 a slice! The hotel staff was very pleasant and very helpful for directions! All in all, we had a great stay and the price wasn't ridiculous for the location. We will book this hotel again when we come back to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ATCCSCS
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for NYC. It is clean and fairly priced. It is in a good location, just one block off time square so it is quiet enough but close to the action. There is a subway entrance just down the street for convenience as well as the bus terminal across the street. The rooms are small, but that is standard for NY so that's not a complaint against the hotel. The plusses are that the hotel offers free internet (it is wired in the room though, no wifi) and free breakfast. The breakfast area is always crowded but they offer a good selection of fruits, bagels and biscuits. There is also fresh coffee available 24 hours a day. Overall, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good value commensurate with NYC prices”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Good: outstanding location; clean, well appointed, and comfortable room - particularly the bed, in typical Marriott fashion, and bathroom - proportionately bigger than the room itself; very helpful and friendly staff; and good brkfst. Reserved a AAA rate of $247/nt 3 months in advance of our Sept 7-9 stay and then added 2 more nts. with Marriott pts. for a total stay of 5 nts. If you can do something similar, we highly recommend this property. The Bad and the Ugly: Rooms are small and brkfst room is crowded, as others have said, but ask for a quiet room and simply be prepared and patient to scope out a table at brkfst, giving yourself more than 15 min. If you keep your expectations in check, particularly considering NYC prices, you'll enjoy the experience because this place makes it all so accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazycervantes
Reviews.Content: The hotel had great hospitality and the staff treated us well. It was in a great location and close to Times Square and subway. Free breakfast was a plus, but you need to get there early if you want a table. The only drawback was there was a Probation Deparment on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay rooms, crowded breakfast”
Reviews.Author: okedem
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, and is just a few blocks from Times Square, and half a block from a subway station. The street isn't the best, but it wasn't bad, including at night. The room was quite small (as is common in NYC hotels), but comfortable. While breakfast was available, the dining room was much too small for the number of people (more than 200 rooms), and we had to wait quite a while to find a table. The food itself was standard. To sum it up - quite good, if you can get a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “SO.. so”
Reviews.Author: Majorwinters
Reviews.Content: It is convenient because it is close to Times Square but that s only the reason to go, small hotel, small rooms , price si high comapre to service and breakfast is in a small room, not so clean, you have to wait to get a breakfast not really good. Will not recommend it or only for 1 night if nothing else is available at better price close to Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to be close to Time Square”
Reviews.Author: needmoretime
Reviews.Content: We had an overall good experience with our stay in this hotel from Aug 20 to Aug 25, 2011. The hotel is located accoss from the Port Authority station so there is a lot of car and foot traffic 24/7 but that is a good thing from a security point of view. This hotel is located between the Fashion District and Time Square. You are 10 minutes away from Time Square and It is a 20 minute walk to Central Park or 5th Ave. Our 2 double bed room was clean and modern which suited us just fine since we were always out from morning to night. Included in the room rate was the breakfast which was the standard fare. One thing different they offered was breakfast sandwiches that you can heat up in the microwave. Coffee was Starbucks. Also note that when we were there, the breakfast area was busy and you need to wait to find a table to eat. It was free wired Internet in the room and Wifi was available only in the lobby area. There are 4 elevators for 30+? floors so we prepared to wait for an elevator. Staff was friendly and helpful in offering directions to tourist attractions and in using the subway. After a few days, we felt comfortable there and would consider staying there again when in the Time Square area.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: 0_TiPine_0
Reviews.Content: I went there on the labor day weekend...it was AMAZING...from the breakfast to the rooms...everything was on point! its just in front of the port authority station so if you go to NY by Greyhound or any bus u just have to cross the street...the staff is really nice too...plus beautiful lounge on the rooftop when ur bored at night...it's FREE if you stay at the hotel....beautiful decor...luv this place...will return everytime i'm in new york :D

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here again”
Reviews.Author: ilovemiami
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, close to subway, walking distance to Time Square etc. Clean, comfortable room (large for NYC standards), free breakfast and coffee was a plus. Rooftop lounge had an incredible view and good music. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Contemporary lobby that always smells great. Cons: Stand up shower only with tricky knob, you will get sprayed with cold water every time. Elevators can be slow at times. However, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Mish M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during August 2011. We were afraid of Bed bugs and choose the hotel based on the reiews on Trip Advisor. The hotel was clean and located near time square, NO bed bugs. Good basic breakfast. Staf were OK altough not very nice, Overall - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Karen806
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 4 nights in August. The hotel was clean and the staff were helpful and attentive. The air con was a bit noisy and the breakfast area was small but neither were major problems. It's located nr times square but not too noisy and is very handy for the port authority bus terminal and subway. The room was compact but there was plenty of wardrobe and drawer space and the in room safe was great to have. A decent selection of food and drinks for breakfast as well as starbucks coffee in the rooms. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel but too busy!”
Reviews.Author: Hayles_s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and it was great for locality! Check in was very speedy and we were placed on the 7th floor which wasn't ideal but because the hotel was so busy we didn't Bother asking for something else! When we got to the room I couldn't fault the cleanliness although it was a little small it done the trick! The only complaint I had was that our bucket contained a rotten banana skin which was there when we arrived and they didn't provide us with clean towels for the shower nor bottles of water were not there for the coffee machine though they did have Starbucks in the main lobby! Breakfast to Put it In one word...nightmare but I put it down to he labour day weekend! There were cereals, bagels,fruit, muffins and yogurts nothing fancy really. I would come back again, it's a lovely hotel with great amenities and the staff were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dubsthcentralboy
Reviews.Content: First off, I arrived after a series of missed flights and terrible airport experience to find check in an absolute pleasure. It was after 1am and the receptionish was expecting me and had things sorted in less than a minute. He offered throughly helpful advice about breakfast, a street map, our location and other things like the rooftop bar. When I got to my room I found it to be to a high standard and exactly what one would expect from a Marriott room with flat-screen television, a large comfortable bed and suitably appointed furnithre. Breakfast is slightly chaotic as there is quite a small area and a lot of guests but nothing unpleasant. There is a wide selection of both hot and cold snacks for breakfast. European guests will be somewhat bewildered by the hot selection which consists of pre-wrapped bacon or sausage sandwhiches which one simply places in the microwave and heats up. They were strangely appealing! (si fueris Romae, Romano vivitomore; si fueris alibi, vivito sicut ibi!) The free internet (cabled) in the bedrooms is invaluable as is the free tea and coffee available in reception 24/7. Some other reviewers mentioned that the street was slightly dodgy and it's true that it has a parole office, some pornographic bookstores and a liquor store but I felt completly safe. It is right in the heart of the Big Apple and the theathre district and TImes Square is just a few blocks away. There is also a subway station a two minute walk from the hotel and the Port Authority Bus Depot is just across the road. I will be returning to New York next year and will have absolutely no hesitation in staying here again, I will also happily recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you expect from a Marriot”
Reviews.Author: cbstephen
Reviews.Content: Check in fast and efficient. Family of four sharing a room and there was adequate space. Location good for all the sights etc, but immediate vicinity with Port Authority Terminal directly opposite can be a bit off putting. Fact of the matter is that with four days in NY we spent the greatest part of the day out and about, so don't let a few minutes each day getting in and out of hotel put you off. With a family of four the free breakfast was a real benefit, and got us off to a good start. Coffee machine in room also helped. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good price”
Reviews.Author: DLam57
Reviews.Content: The room is very clean, a bit small but very well located near Time Square and one corner from subway. Breakfast included but small area. The only thing is the elevators are small And very long. But I still think it is a good deal. Iwould go back.

Reviews.Title: “great,clean,excelent location,good price”
Reviews.Author: kirabello
Reviews.Content: very clean, good beds, customer service is amazing, they really took care of our need for transportation, the frre breakfast was awesome, because included breakfast sauge and bacon sandwiches that you could heat up. the only problem is that they have a lounge that is very popular on top of the buildin, and they have one of the elevators dedicated just for the lounge, and that created baglogs in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times Square Choice”
Reviews.Author: Geomin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent value. Largest room I have ever had in Manhattan. Clean, comfortable rooms with nice city views. Staff was young, friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Breakfast was a terrific surprise. Only negatives I can think of was the lack of the free wifi in the rooms.
