You had to go down to the lobby for it to work. Elevators were slow. Will stay here next time we are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here two years in a row”
Reviews.Author: Travel4fun0498
Reviews.Content: Because the hotel location is very convenient. Staff is great and they serve Starbucks coffee in the morning. Complimentary breakfast offers a good variety of choices. However, the rooms are small and we have to have two rooms for four people. Location: It is only two blocks from Times Square. It's across the street from the Port Authority bus station and six blocks from Penn Stn. Subway station is just around the corner. Bryant Park is about 3 blocks away. Central Park is at 8th Ave and 59th St. The hotel is at 8th Ave and 40th St. We walked to Central Park every morning and it was a good walk. As other reviewers mentioned, the street between 8th and 9th Ave has a rough appearence/feel but I feel completely safe even at 10pm. Food: many choices near the hotel from cheap eats to "need-a-second-mortage"! Cheap eat - John's pizza. Need a second mortage to eat at Inayka (on 40th St just across from 8th Ave) and Keene's on 34th or 36th St. Both good but expensive. Not something I'd do at home but a good treat on vacation. Also had lunch at Becco's which was ok. There are lots of restaurants on 9th Ave between 40th and 55th. My friend was going to take us to Room Service (Thai food) on 9th Ave but the wait was too long. Maybe next time. We flew into Newark and caledl Dial 7 for a private cab at the airport. Fare was $58 inluding tolls. It took about an hour during rush hour. We flew out of JFK and again used Dial 7. I think the fare was about $55. There is a $4 off coupon in one of the NYC tourist magazine. It took about 45 min. If you don't have lots of luggages, the E train (I believe) takes you there for $2!

Reviews.Title: “Decent location and average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerfromnc
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriotts' frequently for work. I stayed at this location for 1 night after coming back from a European vacation trip. Like many smaller NYC hotels, they do not have enough elevators to handle the traffic and number of floors - so be prepared to wait and potentially stop at every floor if you are going in or out during a busy part of the day. The room was average and probably a bit larger than most NYC hotel rooms. The design of their stall shower (at least in the room I had) needs to be re-evaluated - you basically have to almost get inside of the shower stall to turn the water on thanks to a poorly positioned glass wall, so you get a lovely burst of cold water on you before you have the ability to adjust the temp. The breakfast area was packed and noisy, but they offered a good selection of items. There were a few random homeless people taking advantage of the free food but that happens at a lot of hotels.... Location is not ideal but not horrible either. You will be on 40th between 8th and 9th. So you basically have to walk 2 long blocks east and a few blocks north to really be in what I would consider "times square". The farther west you go I do find that area to be a little less desirable, so I'm not sure if I'd want to be out walking to my hotel there at 2am - but if you are out at reasonable hours it seems safe. There was a parole office on the same block, so I think you do get some interesting characters around because of that vs. a more busy touristy street, plus you are right at the port authority bus station - so yeah, it's not central park east.... But, if you can get a good rate and you want to be in mid-town, it is a decent option.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: liz7614
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were helpful but not friendly. The location is close enough to Times Square to walk, but it's also a bit seedy. Everything about this property is small - the lobby, breakfast area, and room. We were not able to get an early check-in. For those not flying, Penn Station and the Port Authority are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Patti S
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Fairfield Inn while sight-seeing in New York. We wanted a hotel within walking distance of the theatre district and this hotel fit the bill. After reading mixed reviews, I was apprehensive, but once we checked into our room I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and comfortable; small, but not cramped for the 2 of us. The breakfast area is small, but we were always able to find a table. Nice variety of food available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinJasmine
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of location to Times Square. We had no problems with elevator slowness or the "seedy area" as mentioned in previous reviews. It's only 1 block off the Times Square action and really close to everything. Subway is only steps away on the corner, plenty of places to eat, almost too many to choose from! The lobby of the hotel just glistens and the staff were so nice, not snobby or uncaring as in some hotels. The room itself was a good size and very clean. Our room was directly across from the elevator and we never heard anything. Free breakfast was a great way to start the day! Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Crowded crowded crowded.... The hotel is tiny and crazy!”
Reviews.Author: abhaagarwal
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 11, who booked three rooms. I have stayed in NYC hotels earlier and this by far has the tiniest and cramiest rooms for a 4 person occupancy. I mean seriously either they think the rooms are for dwarfs or really tiny people. there is no room to walk around the room, you got to jump over the beds to get to the other side phew! We got breakfast included in our reservation and trust me its NOT worth it. Firstly the breakfast area is on the reception floor at the backside and its again very small. In the morning when we got down to eat breakfast, we were shocked at the sea of people literary jumping over you to get food. Its better not to eat than eat here. Also the hotel has 3 elevators out of which one is used since the afternoon until the wee hours of the morning for the sky room. The hotel is divided into two halves one for a measly lobby that they call and the other half for the sky room. Oh! And not to forget every morning at 8 am we had the annoying cleaning ladies knock our door loudly and ask us if we wanted to clean our room. We were on a holiday and would like to sleep until atleast 9:30 am and bang bang bang you have someone knocking your door. One morning while I was in the shower the cleaning lady kept knocking and after two knocks when I did not answer the women used her key card and literary jumped inside the room. This is the heigh of manners. I would definitely not stay here ever. The only good thing is, its near everything and you can walk down to all major areas. Avoid staying here. There is a distrik hotel and staybridge right next door, they share the same boundary wall.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe...”
Reviews.Author: revmobofo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield for a weekend celebrating our 35th anniversary. We have stayed in Manhattan many times, and were surprised at how expensive this hotel was, in spite of getting a discounted rate. Once there the room was clean and nice enough, noise to a minimum considering we were right in the middle of the busiest of areas, the bed was comfortable etc. The breakfast area was very crowded- hard to find seat, though the food was just fine, with lots of options. The "concierge" didn't seem to know her business and did not offer to give us much help in securing tickets or other things we asked her about. This was disappointing. Overall it was an enjoyable weekend, but the hotel was lackluster overall.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and staff including the sky room staff and security”
Reviews.Author: trefloro
Reviews.Content: Had the best time @ the sky room myself and 9 other family members had the best waitress aleena not sure how 2 spell her name but great service. The entire security staff as well great from the red carpet 2 the elevator 2 the security up on the roof very nice and enjoyed all of them. Truly they made me and my family's first night in NYC a night we'll always remembe ( heres a shoutout 2 dorian chris robert and the other guy who was always @ the elevator i cant believe i cant remember your name sorry ). Now the entire hotel staff as well was courteous, very helpful and very very nice superb (shout out 2 paul ivan dale and james and everyone else). Loved it there can't say enough great things about it thank you all 4 helping 2 make my first time in NYC that much more amazing you all r the best and seriously I miss you all!!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay. Will try another hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: LadyHawkTexas
Reviews.Content: The room as average. Clean, but small. No fridge or 'extras'. No AC in the hallways, but you have a window unit in your room. The staff was friendly. The remodeled lobby was beautiful. However, they only had 2 elevators working for the 30 something floors. The best part was the Sky Lounge Roof Top Bar. It was a hot spot for NY. Beautiful people in their 20's and low 30's. Dress code was strictly enforced. Locals seemed to enjoy the bar. It has 3 rooms. The best is the plush setting on the roof. It had a beautiful view. This hotel isn't for you if you want a quiet, plush, special place to stay. For us, it was exactly what we needed. A place to lay our head at night.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the rough”
Reviews.Author: LuAnnS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn for our 33rd wedding anniversary! We wanted to stay near Times Square and our travel agent booked this hotel because of the great price and location. We had to walk about a half a block through some 'rougher' area off 8th Avenue to get to the hotel, but we were pleasantly surprised the minute we walked in the door. It's very modern and updated and the staff was friendly. The rooms are small but very clean and modern. The breakfast area is very modern and offers a variety of bread, cereal, fruit, juice, and coffee. The only hot item is an egg, english muffin sandwich you can heat in the microwave, but we found it a great way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: RobinLG
Reviews.Content: For New York the room was spacious. Very clean. Service at front desk was helpful. Employees on the elevators showed appreciation for us staying there. Breakfast was nice perk with helpful staff. We were on the 26th floor so very little street noise. Bus station across the street but buses enter and exit on a different street so no buses on this street.

Reviews.Title: “Three Southern Girls had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: 2goodboysmom
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at this hotel from the 22-25th of July. We had a wonderful time! We had a view of Times Square, great front desk service, delicious breakfasts, and a lot of friendly employees greeting us and making us feel welcome and special every day. The room was very comfortable, especially the beds. The shower was very nice. Everything was clean and fresh. I can't think of one negative thing to say. Every aspect of our stay was exceptional. The location might give some who are unfamiliar with the ciy pause, but the block between Eighth and Ninth Avenues is really no worse than many others, and there was never a time we felt unsafe. And from the lines to get in to the Sky Room, I'd say this would be a great place for young people who love to go out to clubs. It's right upstairs with wonderful views, including the Empire State Building. I reccommend this hotel with out hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny space”
Reviews.Author: z75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. It is easy to access the subway from here. The walk to Times Square is also very short. It is right across the street from the Port Authority, which caused our driver (from the airport) to warn us that it can be a little dangerous at times. We were fine throughout our stay. The lobby is bright and clean. Everything about the hotel is tiny (which is common in NYC). The rooms were very small (and the air conditioner was LOUD). The hallways and elevators were small. The breakfast room was the worst. There was no room to move and it had a poor setup. The only coffee station was in the corner and it could accommodate just one person at a time. This led to a line being formed, which further bottlenecked to room. Overall, breakfast was not a relaxing environment. However, everything else was fine. All we really did in the hotel was sleep and shower. We were out all day and night, so all we really needed was a place to sleep and this hotel was fine for that. It is certainly not a luxury hotel or a place you just want to hang around in for any length of time. There is a nice bar on the roof of the hotel. Young people were lined up down the street to get in to the place. We went up there one night, but could not get anyone to take our order. I guess the waitresses only wanted to wait on young men. My group of four girls was totally ignored. We left after 20 minutes and went to the Blue Ruin right around the corner. The was way less pretentious. We were served right away.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: friendsofjanis
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel because of its cleanliness, super-friendly staff, wonderful breakfast, and really sleek decor. This was our first trip to NYC so we didn't really know what area to stay in and we sort of guessed. We couldn't have picked a more perfect spot! This hotel is within walking distance of three different subway lines, Penn Station (for Amtrack and many bus lines), and the drop off site for MegaBus which is a great way to travel to NYC from any nearby northeast cities. Because of the many nearby subway options, it was extremely easy to get anywhere else in town like the Statue of Liberty ferry, Wall St, the East Village, Chinatown, Little Italy, West Chelsea & The Meatpacking district, central Park, and Times Square. We would definitely look to this hotel as our first choice for the next trip to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great respite in the hustle of NYC.”
Reviews.Author: lindabail
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after a cruise out of Brooklyn. Fast check in. Great staff. Room was clean and after walking around NYC all day, to find a quiet, clean room with a great, comfortable bed was wonderful. Across the street from the Transportation Bus Authority was at first daunting. However that place has been turned into a food mall that is so clean and organized. NYC has done an amazing job giving Times Square and Penn Station a complete facelift that it is a welcome time to take Amtrak all over the east coast. Only down mention is in the evening one elevator out of three is used for a roof top club. But the staff to make sure that only the right people are using the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ruoska
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the 2 nights in July 2011. The hotel is in very central location in the middle of the city. No problems at all in terms of some of the "shady" shops located in the same street. I would say they are pretty normal in the downtown anyway. Stayed in the 16th floor on the opposite side to the main street. No noise from anywhere during the nights. Room was ok size and very clean. Breakfast was included in the price and was very busy in the morning. The selection was more towards processed / american style but there were some fruits / yoghurts / bagels available as well. Free fitness room was available as well which was great. There are 3 computers for free internet usage in the lobby as well as free wifi (no wifi in room itself). The elevators can be a bit slow which can be a bit annoying but this is a minor thing.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Believe This is a Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: hubby1939
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointed from the moment we turned on the street -- it was littered with trash, street people and was not at all what I expected. it is also not in Times Square! The lobby is small and was overflowing with people. The three elevators are small and only hold maybe 5-6 people (without luggage) and are extremely slow. The room was horrible - - we had one "complimentary" bottle of water for two guests. When I called to asked for more, I was told they were out of water. I then asked for water glasses (there were none in the room) and was told they would bring me more paper coffee cups. The bar was unattended (the bar tender was flirting with a girl outside) and he certainly was not in a hurry to wait on us. We ended up not using the bar at all -- I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We had booked three nights, but I refused to stay more than the one night. We arrived late or I probably would not have even stayed that one night. Fairfield Inn & Suites - NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Good location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: sgin21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from 2nd July, & really enjoyed our stay. The hotel lobby, breakfast room, & the rooms were very clean, & the staff really helpful & friendly. The room rate was great for such a central location, & included breakfast too. The location was really good, next to the Port Authority Terminal for the subway to anywhere in the city, & only a few minutes walk from Times Square. We had no problems walking in the streets nearby in the evenings, & didn't feel uncomfortable, even late at night. The breakfast room was busy each morning, but we always found a table even though there were 4 of us. The selection of food available was good, especially as it was included in the room rate. There were good views up 8th Avenue from the Sky Room, which we were able to visit briefly, although we didn't use the Bar. If we return to New York, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Super Convenient”
Reviews.Author: masAndrew
Reviews.Content: Yes, the street in which this hotel is on is not that great. It's right next to the NY Parole Office, along with a few adult bookstores. There were also many interesting characters roaming the street at night, but don't let that deter you from staying here, no really.. The location of this hotel is perfect, right across from the port authority bus and subway terminal that takes you anywhere in the city and far enough away from the Zoo that is Times Square (only a block away from all the crowds and hawkers if you are craving that). The hotel itself was great, everything is brand spanking new, hallways were very tight but not a problem unless you are a little wide. The rooms themselves were spacious enough and the bathrooms were practically new. The free breakfast in the morning was pretty basic, "Starbucks" coffee, bagels, juice, pastries, cereal, but definitely enough for most people. Be advised that breakfast time is very crowded and there is very little sitting space since the hotel is very small. The only things that I disliked about this hotel were the elevators. They are very slow and since the hotel is 25 or so floors and only 6 rooms per floor it takes forever to get to the lobby especially during peak hours and if you are coming from a higher floor. I stayed on the 23rd floor and trying to get to the lobby on a Sat morning literally took me 10 min since we stopped at every floor. I would recommend getting a lower floor if at all possible. Street noise from the room was not an issue so spare yourself the aggravation. Also the "Free WiFi" is not reliable at all and when it worked it was beyond slow , so don't depend on it. Luckily there was a business center with 3 computers and printer all free to use for guests.

Reviews.Title: “nice choice near Times Square and Javits Center”
Reviews.Author: MichBustrav
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Marriott in the city. The rooms are on the small side, and the hallways are very small (typical city hotel). The lobby is nice (newly redone), and there's a nice bar/breakfast area with breakfast included. It's right between the Javits center and Times Square, and an easy walk to both. It's directly across from the Port Authority (bus station), so there are some characters on the street and you can hear some of the bus noise from the front rooms. Security is good, and they seem to keep a good eye on who is coming/going from the lobby. Wired internet in the rooms, wireless in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: Long4Tahoe
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but very nicely appointed. Breakfast was nothing special but there was enough space that it was not jam packed during the morning rush. There is a Sky Top bar located on the top of the hotel that has wonderful 360 views of the city. They are separate from the hotel so you couldn't sign drinks to your room. The down side to this hotel is that one elevator is dedicated to the Sky Bar leaving only two to service their 30 some odd floors. Spent a good deal of time waiting for an elevator a few times. The staff I interacted with were wonderful, very informative and professionally friendly. All in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: The_Dudes
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our weekend stay and could not have picked a better property to stay at. Easy drive right off of the Lincoln Tunnel (although Sat afternoon traffic was hectic) and easy walk to everything. I was worried my 9 and 12 year old would complain about having to walk, but we easily made it to Central Park and all the attractions nearby. Good selection of food places nearby. Really liked Schnipper's on 8th right in front of the bus station. Only complaint would be the Concierge. She was totally useless in helping us plan a walk in the area to all the sights. She handed us a map and that was it. My wife finally went back and asked her specific questions and had her mark the map. She seemed insulted that we were bothering her while she "worked". Breakfast was good and plentiful. I was hesitant when I got a street facing room on the 9th floor, but it was relatively quiet and leaving the radio on the all night opera station made a pleasant background sound to sleep to. $24 per day parking in the garage before the hotel was very reasonable for the area. If you are going to park, you might consider driving into the garage before checking in. This way you can avoid the hassle of having to drive around the block to get back to the parking after checking in. Hotel validates your parking ticket afterwards to get the discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BDKnight
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was very clean and tidy, fabulous room and luxurious bed! Very clean restroom, reasonable views. Breakfast was good although, being English, I did miss be able to have toast and a nice cup of tea! I did find it noisy, but then I guess everywhere in New York is noisy. It's right opposite the Port Authority which I thought was a noisy building (air con and buses going in all day and night) but nothing which interrupted sleep. Great location, 5 mins walk to Times Square. We also walked to Empire State (about 20 mins) and we also walked the other way to Central Park, stopping at various points along the way, inc the Rockefeller Centre. Good mini supermarket just one block along. Although we didn't use it, there is a subway station at the end of the road. We did feel safe all the time walking up the road, but if you're worried you can always walk through the Port Authority building. The staff were very welcoming and polite, apart from one person who would not help us when we had trouble making a phone call (I later found out from our holiday rep that the hotel should've made this call for us, but the person in charge at the time may have been unaware of this). The hotel were happy to look after our luggage on our day of departure, between checking out, and us being picked up. All in all I would say this is a fab hotel and fab location and would definitely stay there again. It was a pleasure to have such a lovely room to come back to at the end of a hectic day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pink-princess-1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my sister, this hotel is in a great location right opposite port authority bus station a few minutes walk from times square. Rooms were clean and modern and free breakfast was yummy with good views from the sky lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: lily1967
Reviews.Content: Great room, Great service, Great Price. Cheap bu Nrw York standard but woth a whole lot more. #I enjoyed my stay and will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeous2000
Reviews.Content: We intitially chose this hotel based on location (amazing - 2 blocks from Times Square just far enough away from the madness). free internet, free business centre (in case you haven't got a laptop you can surf the web here) and fitness centre. Local calls are free too - all great bonuses. The lobby and lounge were being refurbished on our arrival, not a prblem in itself but it meant that breakfast was served in the roof top bar - a bit of a mare eating on your knees at coffee tables but this is only a temporary measure and drawings of the new breakfast area look very nice. Continental breakfast was good but could have included some cold meats and cheese other than Philadelphia. The rooms felt a bit on the small side but I may not be the best judge as we'd just come from a massive Marriott timeshare apartment in Vegas - that said they were nicely designed, clean and comfortable as you would expect of a member of the Marriott family and let's face it you don't go to NYC to sit in your hotel room so again not really a problem. However annoyingly the rooms didn’t have hairdryers despite saying so on the hotel website. The staff were fantastic - polite, friendly and incredibly helpful. The Skyroom Bar has an entrance directly to the street with a bouncer outside all night so you feel very secure if returning late - guests have priority access. I didn't check this out as had a teen with me (no bars until you're 21 in US). All in all the hotel offers a great location, great value, comfortable rooms and immensely helpful staff – not a lot more you could ask for really. Will definitely return on next trip and would be happy to recommend. Ooh and if you can;t face another restaurant and fancy a takeaway, the Chinese cafe a couple of doors down is very good but don't over order - the portions are at least twice the size of the UK and everything already comes with rice

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: briannalynn
Reviews.Content: Upon entering, the hotel was gorgeous! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice and inviting. The location was great, only a block or two until you're on the main streets of Times Square. The continental breakfast was magnificent, there was SO many different foods to choose from. I can't think of a single bad thing to say about this hotel, it was splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: douceophelie
Reviews.Content: Very cute. Very clean. The breakfast included at this hotel was good and practical. It's a 5 minutes walk from Times Square, which is close enough without being noisy. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist hotel, but fine for business”
Reviews.Author: LAXrunner
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was a great value considering competing rates in NYC. The rooms were all very new inside and clean and comfortable. I was visiting for business and there were lots of tourists in the hotel, but I didn't mind because the location was perfect for me to visit all my mid-city clients.

Reviews.Title: “Crisp White Linen!”
Reviews.Author: WilsonDBG
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, I travelled with friends and my 16 year old daughter. We had three in our room and although snug, we had great night's sleep after busy days in NYC. The beds were so comfortable and very clean. The ongoing renovations meant we had breakfast in the Sky room (33rd floor) with great views of the city. We visited the Sky room at night when it became a cocktail bar (its open until 4am); perfect place to see the city knowing you only had to grab the elevator to your room. The staff were very helpful and it was an ideal location for the tourist who wants to see it all. Planning to use this hotel again when I take my husband to New York next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jhasko
Reviews.Content: . We picked the Fairfield for Valentine weekend because of both the great price and prior reviews. The staff, esprcially Luis, are exceptional. The rooms are clean and the area convenient. Although it could be called Hell's Kitchen as well as Times Square it is a great location. Unlike the other reviewers, I love 9th Ave., it may not have the eloquent look of 5th or Broadway, but it contains some of the best neighborhood restaurants in New York at great prices. Just up from the hotel you can buy a pizza slice for $1 as good as any in town. The breakfst room has been moved to the nightclub area and seating can be tough when it is buzy, but that will end with the rennovation. Also, the nightclub is a NYC hot spot and on Sat night can be a little loud, so I suggest you ask for a room below the 28th floor.There is a subway nearby, but we took a cab to Lincoln Center for $10. On Sunday, we walked to St Patricks and Rockefeller Ctr. in about 30 minutes taking our time and people watching as we went. It is a very good hotel, with an incredible staff and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the budget traveler.”
Reviews.Author: ryanleeh
Reviews.Content: I visit and stay over-night in NYC roughly 2 or 3 times per year. usually for one night at a time. this is a perfect hotel for that. Good for seeing a show or a headquarters for sightseeing. we saw a show, went to 2 restaurants and even rode the subway to the west village. I found the location perfect. the hotel is going through lobby renovations. seems it will be nicer when that is finished. check-in staff was great. they had my room ready at noon. surprise. free breakfast was fine. was not looking for gourmet as it is free. perfect. did not go to the restaurant/night club on the roof, but did look at it, and it may be worth visiting. room was clean. perfect. as we were only in the room from 11pm until checkout for the price, definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for business or shopping in midtown”
Reviews.Author: MN_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 weeks on business in NYC and stayed at this hotel. Overall it was a good choice. The rooms are on the small side but attractive and well appointed. The bathrooms appeared recently redone, high quality and clean. There is a nice breakfast area including complimentary breakfast buffet and round-the-clock, excellent quality coffee. I also took advantage of the fitness center many times. The hotel is located on one side of the Port Authority. This location is the only disadvantage, as that one block off of 8th avenue can be unpleasant, especially at night. On the other hand, you can walk to many restaurants, theaters, shops and other attractions, or pick up the subway at the central 42nd st station very close by. I would not recommend this hotel for families due to the location and small room size, however, I would return myself either on business or pleasure. The staff was also helpful and accommodating, for example when I requested a room change (I prefer lower floors because the elevators can be slow) or asked about restaurants in the area. The price varied a lot depending on the particular week but was certainly competitive for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a good bargain”
Reviews.Author: ecargo
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn and Suites Times Square has a lot going for it: friendly staff members, from the desk clerks to the housekeeping crew; really nice rooms; great location near to Times Square, Port Authority, and subway stations; bargain prices for NYC; and a free breakfast thrown in for good measure. We stayed here a cold and snowy evening last weekend, and the proximity to the subways was a godsend. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the heart of Times Square, too, with plenty of hotels, shopping, and sightseeing to choose from. The rooms were lovely--this is NYC, so don't expect giant rooms, but these were large enough to be comfortable, with new and very nice furnishings, a comfortable bed, IPOD-ready clock radio/alarm, and flatscreen TV. Free wifi was included in the price. The room and bathroom were spotless and appeared to have been recently updated. The heating system was pretty noisy but the room was hot enough that we turned it off for the night and were very comfortable. Because the lobby/bottom floor of the hotel is undergoing renovations, breakfast was served in the Sky Lounge, the hotel's rooftop bar. For a continental breakfast, I thought there was a nice variety to choose from: cereal, coffee, danishes, bagels, microwavable egg sandwiches and so on. Don't expect a cooked-to-order breakfast or even a hot buffet, but for the price (i.e., included in your rate), it's a pretty good deal. The one downside we experienced was that noise from the hallway could be a bit much. Some IDIOT woman decided that talking on her phone outside our room at 3 a.m. was a good idea--my language and volume scared her off, but be aware that the soundproofing isn't sufficient to prevent your hearing the inconsiderate idiots loud and clear. Other than that one small blip, we had a wonderful stay. Short version: I highly recommend making the Fairfield Inn & Suites Times Square your base the next time you're in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: jimmy98761
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be an incredible bargain for its location and overall quality. I usually go to New York City at least once every year and I like the hotel to be in the Times Square Area as it makes getting around New York on the Subway easier as just about every line goes through here. I actually liked that this particular hotel was a few blocks from 42nd Street and Broadway as it was on a quieter street between 8th and 9th Avenues. It was right next to the Port Authority with a daytime entrance just across the street. There are two adult video stores on the street, but their windows are solid white and I only saw 1 person go into the store the three days we were there. If this kind of stuff bothers you, go through the Port Authority (entrance open until 8pm) or just walk on the other side of the street at night. The hotel has 30 floors but we stayed on the 10th so I can't say much about the view, all we saw was the parking lot for the Port Authority. We did have breakfast in the Sky Lounge and there is a nice view of Hell's Kitchen and the Hudson River from up there. Breakfast is rather spartan in my opinion. The only fruit available were bananas and apples. They also had bottled apple juice, orange juice and fresh coffee. I thought the blueberry muffins were ok. I tried to have a bagel the first day but the toaster was broken. They did have oatmeal and cereal which I did not try. I did try the frozen quiche and the frozen bagel sandwich the second day, but I did not care for them (not such a fan of frozen food). Thus on the third day my wife and I went elsewhere for breakfast. I liked the size of the rooms and the HD TV. The TV gets 15 HD channels (networks/basic cable) and like 25 standard definition channels. There was ample drawer space and closet room for two people. The shower was nice and while there was not much room on the sink counter, there was plenty underneath it. I also liked the iPod dock/alarm clock. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were too soft in my opinion and there was no blanket provided (however we never asked to see if we could get one). Overall I really really enjoyed my stay at the Fairfield Inn and would highly recommend it to anyone. With a AAA discount the place is a real bargain compared to other hotels in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, a little tricky to find”
Reviews.Author: cx20009
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be a fairly new offering in Marriott's Fairfield Inn brand. That being said, the hotel feels more like an international version of a Courtyard than a US version of a Fairfield Inn. This is a good thing. The color schemes, layout, and decor, while not something I personally like, are a mix between modern and 1980s and seemed to satisfy the others in my group. The hotel's across-the-street neighbor is the Port Authority. Because of this massive structure and the 30-odd floor hotel, the natural light on 40th street between 8th and 9th Avenues is lacking. And in case you ask, yes, there are two porn shops on 40th Avenue. However, the insides of the stores are completely hidden from the street, so don't worry about anything you may not (or may) want to see. I also felt safe walking to and from the hotel at all times. The hotel offers a breakfast is a standard, pre-packaged Fairfield Inn breakfast. Other than the fact that it's free, I find no compelling reason to eat this-- it's neither tasty or nutritional and in (especially) in NYC, someone can do much better in both the tasty and nutritional departments. High floors in this hotel are better-- you're looking above the neighboring buildings instead of looking AT them! Otherwise, the only great views are on the top floor lounge, for which a dress code applies... which I thought strange since Farifield Inn is Marriott's budget brand! There is a subway entrance on 40th street for the 42nd Street Station serving a mulitude of subway lines. Great option for mass transit! None of us used the internet or parking, so I cannot comment on these offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: MrMan81
Reviews.Content: The hotel had some renovations going on and was very loud, but the front desk staff was great in checking in and out. Each time i needed assistance with directions or amenities they were great. The location is wonderful, right in the middle of everything. breakfast was free so no complaints there. The rooms were a bit small, but that how it usually is in New York City. The other great thing they provided free internet, unfortunatly wifi is only in the lobby and wired in the rooms, but it is free. When i needed a taxi the bellman who assisted me had me wait inside while he flagged one down for me in the cold, that was wonderful because it was freezing. i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, ok to stay overnight”
Reviews.Author: roksonak
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a 2-day visit to NYC on reward points. The good: location is convenient - half way between Penn Station and Times Square; rooms can sleep up to four for the same price (that means it is overcrowded as well); rooms are ok and clean. The bad: crowds everywhere; noise from window AC and your neighbors. The ugly: nothing really. Just concierge in the hotel disappointed as he was trying to sell us a specific bus tour. Hint to fellow travelers: there are several PCs downstairs where you can browse internet if you did not bring yours with you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: amwondering
Reviews.Content: Stayed for quick trip to see New Year's Eve in Times Square. (fun!) Hotel is about 4-5 block walk from the Times Square, so decent location, but this particular street along south side of Port Authority bldg was dirtier than others in the area. Not sure if that was b/c of recent blizzard. Check in at hotel was quick and very efficient. Hotel room was small, but clean and comfortable. Continental bkfast was decent, but very crowded. Elevators were painfully slow and at one point we decided to hike up 15 flights instead of wait any longer. Phew!

Reviews.Title: “Ready to return”
Reviews.Author: MEGJE07
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are accurate. We paid $182 per night for two double beds and breakfast. Peach parking is $24 for 24 hours, on right, two doors prior to the hotel entrance. The address of this hotel is perfect for us. Our trip centered on museums, shows and shopping located between 51st street and Soho. It's clean with a friendly staff. We stayed on the 15th floor and had a quiet rest each night. I gave it 4 stars only because the room is tight for four but is fine if you spend all day out and about.

Reviews.Title: “This place isn't in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: glm804
Reviews.Content: This hotel may technically be within walking distance of Times Square, but so is Central Park. It's on W 40th btwn 8th and 9th and you have at least 7 blocks to get to Times Square or the theaters. It shares a street with several porn shops and peep shows. The hotel itself is typical NYC tiny. I bought the parking package and the guys at the garage welcomed me and my kids with lots of "F Bombs" and "GDs". When I went to pick up my car, they wouldn't accept the validation and I had to call the hotel and have someone come over to take care of it. They have only a tiny room for the breakfast so you're fighting crowds to find anywhere to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Great option near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: VipB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Thanksgiving Day. Had a $199 rate which I found incredible for NYC. The hotel is relatively new, which is alwasy a plus. As expected, rooms are small, but not ridiculously small. There is enough space to move around the room. The hotel is not quite on Times Square, but close enough; about a 5-7 minute walk. The hotel street felt safe; don't know why other reviews have expressed concerns about it. My biggest complain is that the lobby, which was small, always seemed to be extremely crowded.

Reviews.Title: “would definately go back!!”
Reviews.Author: welshySouthWales
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that when i comes to hotels i am very fussy...my mum and i booked this hotel for 6 nights.....it iswas spotlessly clean..beds and pillows very comfortable and an ideal location to Times Square. Port Authority bus station across the road with fab access straight to the airport for $15...don't waste your money for an expensive taxi.....The rooftop lounge has fab views of the city but you do pay for this in the cost drinks...The only thing i could moan about is ask for a room at the back or a floor up high..as we were on the 3rd floor and could here everything...and finally...the breakfast was great...lots of choice....filled hot muffins..bagels, cereals, fruit, quiche!!! i know...the americans must like this for breakfast...but it was all lovely....except for the plastic cutlery and throw away plares and bowls.... Faye and mum from Chepstow, South Wales

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: philitalia
Reviews.Content: A hotel nearTimes Square is never a cheap stay, but considering you're in the heart of Manhattan the Fairfield Inn is quite good quality/price. Breakfast is included,but not nice and the breakfast room is very noisy (Americans do not take their weight off the chairs when they move them to get up), but at least there is some breakfast - unlike at many other hotels in the same price range. Rooms are big enough (not huge) and cleaned every day. Staff is very friendly. Rooms on the street side are a bit noisy - woke up every morning at around 6am due to traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snapper54
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after staying 4 nights at this hotel. Location is spot on - only a few hundred yards from Time Square. The room was spotless and, having read some earlier reviews, not nearly as small as we were expecting. You should try Paris hotels they really are small. I chose this hotel for its location but also because breakfast and WIFI were included. I hate having to get up in the morning and having to search for somewhere to eat where I wasn't getting ripped off. I wasn't disappointed. The food was great and as much as you wanted. Nor did we have to wait any time to get a seat although the breakfast area could be bigger. The added bonus we hadn't expected was that as well as having coffee making facilities in our room there was also Starbucks coffee available free in the lobby at all times. We didn't use the Skyroom so can't comment on that but we had no issues with the customers of the adult shops on the same road. I'm sure I will return to New York sometime soon and I wouldn't think twice about booking this hotel again. It helped make a good holiday great. Thanks to all the staff for looking after us so well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowAngie
Reviews.Content: Fairfield Inn New York / Time Square. Great Location only two streets from Time Square, Broadway and also Port Authority which is great for getting into the city from the airport. I would recommend this hotel for location, great hotel room, free breakfast and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, central to everywhere and value for money, staff are pleasant, GREAT.”
Reviews.Author: australian2000
Reviews.Content: We arrive late and was greeted pleasantly by the duty reception manager. He looked after us well, all in all everything was sorted out in a few minutes and up we go to our rooms. Rooms were clean and pleasant. Breakfast was simple but good; no frills and help yourself to everything buffet. Conceirge was helpful in everyway.

Reviews.Title: “A great location at a reasonable price(for New York)”
Reviews.Author: johntCardiff_WalesUK
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the hotel during a short break in New York, it is tall and thin with only 8 rooms per floor, and a rather up market club/bar on the very top, the outside section had great views, although the weather was not that good and the top of the Empire State Building was lost in the mist. The rooms were clean and well equipped, the staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was Ok and better than I expected after a couple of the earlier reviews. The bar on the top floor had only just been opened when we stayed, it was smart and had a separate entrance with quite large security guards. The location is convenient, right next to the bus station where the Newark airport drops travellers, Times Square itself is about 10 minutes walk, the area has been described as seedy at night, and there are a few "characters" around, but you can always come back by taxi, and if you walk the security guards on the Skyroom are close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWell040
Reviews.Content: For the last four years we stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel. This time we thought of trying to save money, earn points with Marriott, but still be close to subway lines in Times Square. The Fairfield Inn was an excellent choice. The staff is very friendly and willing to please. The rooms are clean, the complimentary breakfast adequate (don't expect bacon, steak, and eggs), and located within easy walking distance to 4 subway lines. It is a safe area to walk and close to all types of restaurants that are more than adequate. Also, no history to date of bed bugs. The theater district is within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “No bedbugs and the entire city at your feet.”
Reviews.Author: jupaws
Reviews.Content: My family stays at Marriott's regularly and are almost never disappointed. This hotel was no exception. Clean,comfortable rooms, great service and a free breakfast in Times Square; what more could you want? My husband and I were in NY to meet some friends that we haven't seen in a long time and to go to a concert in Central Park. We shared our room with another couple to cut costs and still had plenty of space. Our trip centered around eating and we found quite a few great little restaurants near the hotel. More importantly the hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Subway, so you are a minutes away from pretty much everything.

Reviews.Title: “This Fairfield Inn is MORE than adequate”
Reviews.Author: bogie27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn in Times Square in late September 2010. We read many of the reviews on tripadvisor prior to booking (sex shops on what seems like a "seedy" street), so we were a bit hesitant, since we would have a small child with us. I'm pleased to say it was "Much Ado About Nothing". This hotel is absolutely fine for a quick getaway on a budget. Yes, it is on a street with some sex shops, so if that absolutely bothers you, then i wouldn't recommend it. But there is another hotel next door (Four Points Sheraton, I think), sandwich shops 3 buildings down the street and the port authority of New York across the street. We walked up and down this street (40th street between 7th and 8th avenues) with a small child during the day and had no cause for concern whatsoever. The hotel itself is more than adequate. The lobby is nice, you get free continental breakfast and free internet in the lobby (only 3 computers as of this writing). The rooms were of average size for a New York hotel. Bathrooms were clean and bed was comfy. They have sort sort of "rooftop" or "skyroom" on the top floor, but you must wear a jacket/slacks to get it...and there may be a cover charg (if this is your thing). The hotel is walking distance (5 minutes) to the heart of Times Square, which is primarily why we chose it. But the other reason was the price...very affordable!!! To conclude, if you're looking for the perfect hotel to celebrate a special occasion, then you probably want to skip this hotel. But if you're looking for a more than adequate hotel that is reasonably priced, you can't beat this hotel....and if the sex shops scare you, just use common sense (no walking alone, be back in the hotel before it's dark or take a taxi to the hotel at night). I would definitely recommend this hotel to families with small children. Hope this is beneficial to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in N.Y.”
Reviews.Author: kalena98
Reviews.Content: My husband & I got to the hotel early Sat. am. The Mng. and Consierge were extremely accomadating with us and we checked into the rm early. The rm was large & clean, the bed comfortable. The location was great. We walked outside the hotel, turned right and were able to see Times Sq. and get on Hop on Hop off bus easily. At night, we were cautious, but the street are filled with people, and we always felt safe.The breakfast was good, very crowded, but we met other travelors & all were nice. We will definately stay here again and highly recommend this Hotel to other visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay here again! Execucar was efficient.”
Reviews.Author: Greta9
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NYC and stayed here for 6 nights. The rooms were small, but clean and having breakfast before leaving the hotel was great. Everyone was very helpful and the conseirge marked the best subway routes on our map--they were always very helpful. We were able to walk to 5 broadway shows because of the great location. There were many good restaurants on 9th street which is just a 1 1/2 blocks away. We always felt safe as there were always people on the streets with 3 hotels side by side. People were very willing to help us on the street or in the subway. We used Execucar for transportation to and from the airport. They were on time--very efficient company with very courteous drivers. It took 1 1/2 hours from the airport to the hotel because of traffic, but only 30 minutes from hotel to airport because we left at 6 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mary115
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was great! Yes it was small but the location was perfect. We were going to a party on the Intrepid and was able to walk. Also subwayed to South Street Seaport. Being a bit neurotic we immediately checked for bedbugs and have to say that everything looked brand new! Also great deal parking next door, $24 for 25 hours with hotel voucher. Definitely going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiniTravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and is only a few minutes away from Times Square. We had 2 rooms (a 1 king and a 2 queen). Both rooms and bathrooms were large. It wasn't very noisy for this location. We are already planning on staying in this hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and nice suites on top floor!”
Reviews.Author: matthewedward
Reviews.Content: Very good location if you want to get to Time Square. I asked to be upgraded as a "gold" member which they did and put me in a suite on the top floor. Very nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My kids enjoyed staying here. Very clean, breakfast was fine and and rooms were quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: keksia
Reviews.Content: I had to go to NY for some personal business and stayed at Fairfield for one night. I took the bus into Port Authority and the hotel is located right next to it. The room I got was modern, quiet, and clean. Checkin and checkout were a breeze. Breakfast was included and the food was good. They had three computers on the first floor with free internet access and printing for guests. Will definitely stay here again when I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, all around PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: viajeraMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location!!!!! It is across the street from Port Authority Bus/Subway station, a block from Times Square. What more do you want? Bkfst included, a bit of a problem getting a table bc of so many people, but eventually you eat and enjoy. Tipical NYCity hotel, every inch is important, the rooms with 2 double beds were good, confortable, clean. The elevators took forever, this was the only problem!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for a Manhattan hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottishMusician
Reviews.Content: We'd recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again. The hotel was clean, tidy, free wi-fi in the lobby/breakfast areas and cables internet in the rooms. The room was big enough, air conditioned and cleaned every day. The location of the hotel is great and, although some reviewers comment on the probation office etc, you'll barely notice any of it - it is perfectly safe. Slight drawbacks to the hotel were - breakfast (which if good) - the area is too small for the size of the hotel and many days we went back to our room with breakfast. You can sometimes wait a bit on a lift but the lifts are quick enough. Another nice positive to the hotel, aside from it being new etc, is the roof terrace (not yet opened when we were there). Also, the manager is about every day and speaks to the guests, which is a first for many hotels. Excellent positive experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great free breakfast, awesome staff, free internet.”
Reviews.Author: groove1
Reviews.Content: We had several gift certificates for Marriott which is how we ended up at this Fairfield Inn and Suites hotel. It was the most inexpensive Marriott branded hotel near Times Square. First, the location is great. From JFK airport, we took the Airtrain to the subway, then the subway to 42nd St/Port Authority bus terminal. It's $5 for the Airtrain and $2.25 for a single subway ride. From there, it is a quick 2 block walk to the hotel. To get back on the subway was even closer though - there is a stop right on the corner of 40th St next to the drug store. This is less than a 1 minute walk. This stop will get you to most places up and down Manhattan. The A, C, E, and 1-7 trains run from it. The A train goes up and down Manhattan while the E train will take you to the World Trade Center. A day pass is $8.25 and you can also use that on the city buses (note that NYC buses do not take dollar bills - you need a MetroCard or exact change in coins.) You can easily walk (about 15-20 minutes), or take a crosstown bus to 42nd St Pier and catch the Circle Line cruises or visit the USS Intrepid. There is a $1 per slice pizza stand on the corner which was surprisingly good for a quick bite of NYC pie. There are 2 adult video stores on the block of the hotel, but you can walk on the other side of the street to avoid them. The heart of Times Square is very close, with every Broadway theatre, restaurants, Madam Tussaud's, the bright lights and more nearby. Rockerfeller Center and Top of the Rock is within walking distance (50th St) as is the Empire State Building and Macy's (34th St). For the record, we enjoyed Top of the Rock much more than the ESB. Everyone working at the hotel was very friendy and helpful (as were most people we talked to in NYC contrary to the stereotypes). The room was small (in Manhattan this was expected) but still had more than enough room. We could see part of the Hudson River from our window which was nice. It will be nice when they open the rooftop which is currently under construction. They offer an awesome deluxe continental breakfast in the morning. It is served near the lobby and it does get crowded, but there is another room with extra seating. The breakfast is self serve and includes cereal, fruit cups, fresh fruit, bagels, coffee cake, english muffins, breakfast sandwiches, juice, Starbucks coffee, tea, and yogurt. Not only did this save us money from buying breakfast, it also saved a lot of time which was precious for a 3 day trip. They also have free cookies and ice water in the lobby in the evenings. There are 3 public computers in the lobby which were most often available, except in the morning when a lot of people were at breakfast. You can print from these computers although we could not print our boarding passes due to the security restrictions. The rooms also have free hardwired internet access although I did not a bring my computer with me (I didn't feel like keeping up with it and also knew the hotel had computers). They also have a fitness center, but walking around NYC will give you all the exercise you need. The beds were comfortable and the HD TV was nice too. The only minor problem we had was that the AC unit was very noisy. I found that if I turned it to fan only, it cooled the room sufficiently at night and was not as noisy. If we return to NYC we will definitely consider staying at this hotel. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just be careful with the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fry_Travel
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Away from the hussle and bussle but close enough to walk anywhere and everywhere in Manhatten. It scores an excellent in everything other than the size of the rooms which for the price you pay you would expect to be able to swing a lion around the room, not just a cat. Still, if you're one of those who like us just want a comfortable place to stay in a great location then this one's well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: jross310
Reviews.Content: New. Clean. Close to subway and Time Square. Good value if you pay 150 to 200 a night. We got a package through travellocity. Watch yourself late at night on 8th a avenue, keep To yourself and you will be fine or take a cab and have thwm drop you at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Hallie50
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went for our birthday celebrations and couldn't have chosen a better location for our stay. The hotel was clean and comfitable, the complimentary breakfast and free wi fi was welcome. The hotel is not far from the port authority bus terminal and just off Times square making it easily accessable. We wil definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: GMgeorgiatraveler
Reviews.Content: Visited in April with a friend for a girls weekend. We had one of the first flights out of Atlanta that morning, so arrived by 9:30 am. When we got to the hotel, we were able to leave our luggage in a room, and were able to request a room with a view of the Empire State Bldg - when we came back late that afternoon to check in, we had a wonderful room on the 32nd floor with the view we wanted (if you leaned against the window and looked to the left!) The room was very clean, the bed comfy, and the bathroom clean and spacious, although it was quite awkward to get into the shower as it opened into the shower, which wasn't really big enough to turn around in with the door open. The room was very small, bt more than adequate. The computers in the lobby were great to check emails and print boarding passes, although time limits would be helpful, as there were a couple of teenagers that monopolized the computers for hours. The continental breakfast was good, but definitely get there early, as the food runs out. The bathrooms in the lobby are very large and clean. The location is wonderful - we took a shuttle from the Newark airport, which let us out at the Port Authority bus terminal, around the corner from the hotel. It is also less than a block from the subway stations. We felt safe coming back, even after dark, as there was a decent police presence in the area. I would defintely stay there again, although I do agree with other reviews that say this would not be a great place for kids!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: vamktpro
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on business. The room was small, similar to many rooms in Europe and very quiet. Beds were excellent. The price was competitive with hotels of this type, and conveneint to the theater district. The hotel is in a transitional area, you walk by the Police Department Parole Center where criminals need to check in so if you have young children you may not like staying here.As a single male traveler i would likely stay again. If you are traveling with young childre or a solo female traveler I might explore all my options. Check out Ben's Deli for a good meal!

Reviews.Title: “small hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelforless
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in this hotel. I am not expecting a lot but things did not work well from thestart. First, they made a major mistake in our reservation which is yet to be settled. The room was clean but lacks space. We just we have enough space to walk around the king bed but no room to store our laguage. Good thing we are only staying for a night. The bathroom is also on a smaller size, no tub just a shower. The service is not great. We asked for extra pillows but never recieved it. They claimed the housekeeping is there until midnight and have to wait 6 AM. By then it is time to wake up and check-out. The airconditioner is so loud it kept waking me up. Breakfast is continental and adequate for light breakfast. The breakfast area is cleaned and has a nice decor. It is a plus that they provide 2 computers to check e-mails and to print your boarding pass. Definitely they need to change the chairs in heir small lobby. It has a visible stain. The location is great. It is 6 blocks to Time Square. It is a good hotel if you are staying alone and for few days. I hope they can resolved the reservation problem soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel scary location”
Reviews.Author: lynnreid
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from a four night stay in the Fairfield Inn and overall we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and when we asked for a room with a view we got one on the 23rd floor which gave us a side view of Times Square which was good, lower floor rooms looked straight into the wall of a multi storey carpark opposite. However the street the hotel is on is very seedy with sex shops, adult movie shops and a lot of groups of men standing about which made my daughter and I nervous especially coming home at night we found it really quite scary. This is a shame as the hotel is great but i would not stay here again because of the location . Lynn Reid Scotland May 2010

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel, i doth my cap...”
Reviews.Author: royroyroy7
Reviews.Content: wow, what a great hotel. i had mixed feelings after booking this hotel, was concerned that the rooms would be too small and the area would be a bit uncomfortable. well i neednt have worried as our room (2402) on the 24th floor was bigger than id expected with a great view looking towards times square (granted, you cant see the into times square). the bed was huge and we slept great. also, the area is fine day and night. sure theres a couple of sexy shops, and theres a few around the corner on 8th ave aswell. we never had any trouble or even sensed it, even with me in full tourist mode with camera round my neck. times square is about 5 minutes walk, a bit more if youre looking up at the buildings! subway is at the end of the street for A,C,E lines and a short walk to times square subway which has more options for getting about. go left out of the hotel down onto 9th ave and theres a pizza place, '2 bros pizza', where you can get a slice for a dollar. over the road is a cute little place called 'cupcake cafe', we frequented there a couple of times. theres tonnes of places to eat around here if you head uptown, we didnt find this out until the last day though! the service was second to none, the reception staff were exceptional and were always there to help with directions etc. props go to jason, he was a delight. free papers, free internet and also free cookies in the evening were a welcome addition. although the cookies mysteriously werent there after the first night. i must echo other reviewers about the breakfast area, it is on the small size but if its full then take your stuff to the room or eat it on the go. the food provided is perfectly adequate, consisting of cereals, muffins, fruit, bagels, toast, oats, sausage/ham bagel things, and juices/hot drinks. pretty good considering its in with the room rate. overall, this hotel made our visit to new york so much better and easier. id definitely come back next time. the 'skyroom' bar on the top floor should be open soon aswell, so if you get a good rate then dont hesitate to book the fairfield, its a great little place.

Reviews.Title: “what do you spect from hotel in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Shirinak
Reviews.Content: We had a small room with double bedd on the 17th floor. I went there 2:30 and reseption told me the room is not ready and come after an hour. at 4 pm they told me still not ready and if you want we can give you room at 6th floor that I refused. The room was very quiet. The hotel is right across the street from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. This block of 40th Street is ripped up due to construction at the bus terminal. In the block is trashy. there was free Internet and free breakfast. the price was 280 $ per night

Reviews.Title: “They Get It!”
Reviews.Author: louielaskowksi
Reviews.Content: We had a great 5 days in New York staying at this hotel. The bed and room was comfortable and clean. We picked this hotel because there was a continental breakfast which made getting the day started and easy to take an apple for later. We used the Internet everyday and we were grateful to not be charged for this. The small workout room was up-to-date and nice. We also appreciated the free newspapers - sweet touch. We really liked the staff, they were helpful and professional. The room window was small but had a nice night view. Also we are looking forward to the opening of the new restaurant on top of the building since we plan on staying again. They get it, they give you more than basic comfort without "nickeling" you! There are several nice smaller hotels on this street but it is a little seedy around the area-just an FYI near Port Authority. - Show quoted text -

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in fab location!”
Reviews.Author: portisheadgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend in New York and this hotel was perfectly located just off Times Square, within walking distance of the Empire State Building and right next to a subway. The hotel was great - modern, good size rooms, clean, tea/coffee, safe, huge bed and with a decent bathroom and shower - we were very pleased. If you get a choice of room try and get on a high floor so you get a good view. The free buffet breakfast was great - all you can eat and a wide choice - the only down point was there wasn't enough tables to sit at. A couple of the reviews mention the dodgy DVD shops nearby but the area does not feel unsafe and there are recognised hotels on either side. The only down point is that the hotel doesn't have a bar but they are putting one in on the top floor. Would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great service, nice room, ok location"”
Reviews.Author: LargeLadDad
Reviews.Content: We had a great room on the 31st floor. Very friendly and helpful staff. The room was very quiet and well furnished. The issue is the neighborhood -- the hotel is located between 8th and 9th Avenues, which is great, although we were looking to be a bit closer to Times Square. The hotel is right across the street from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. This block of 40th Street is ripped up b/c of construction at the bus terminal. In addition, the block is trashy, except for this hotel, which was very nice. Free Internet and Free Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best...”
Reviews.Author: randomgirl25
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed here from the 3rd to the 10th april. we arrived and was greated in a polite and professional manner and with a smile. we were quickly checked in but there was a small problem...because we didnt have a credit card we had to pay $250 deposit to stay there, i didnt mind this but it did upset me a little bit as we wasnt warned prior to our arrival that this would be necassery!! after we had sorted that out we were told we would be staying on the 29th floor. went upto the room and was shocked at how big and clean the room was. (i have previously stayed in a 5star hotel and the room was much smaller and not as nice). fresh clean sheets, clean towels, complimentary toiletries and complimetary coffee making facilities (not teas as some people have stated) the floor was very quiet and we couldnt hear any noise from outside unless the window was open!! it was a very hot week there and we asked if we would be able to have a fridge in the room...no problem, withing half an hour of us asking the fridge had been set up in our room which enabled to us to get a stock of cold drinks to put in there. breakfast was excellent and a great bonus, fresh ceriel and milk on a daily basis (fruit loops, frosties, shdreddies and cornflakes) fresh muffins and fruit, tea, coffe and juice (apple, orange and cranberry) bread, english muffins and bagels that could be toasted and hot bagel sandwhiches (sausage, egg and cheese and bacon egg and cheese) overall an excellent choice, never had to wait too long to get food. me and my partner decided to eat in our room as the seating area was busy at the times we went for breakfast and we preffered to sit at the window and listen to the early hustle and bustle of new york while enjoyinh the view!! the staff are extremely helpfull and always great you with a smile, we really enjoyed nitghts in the lobby as one member of staff called jason was always happy and always had song for you!! the computers in the lobby are a great perk and we never had to wait too long for one to be free ( if you want to use one id advise between 7 and 10pm as they are always free) the area is excellent evrything you would ever need is within 5 minutes walk of the hotel (pharmacy, local shop, subway and port authority) 42nd street is 2 minutes away (which has ripleys. madame tussauds and cinema's) and times square is a 7-8 minutes walk, really easy to find and easy to find your way back to the hotel. me and my partner never felt unsafe at anytime, yes it is right down the street from the probabtion service but you wouldnt know it, there is also from what we could see 2 adult video stores on the street but dont let that put you off as they dont cause a problem. overall an excellent experiance and brillient hotel. i would deffinately stay here again and would reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants excellent service and a relaxing time!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMan020
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Location is excellent. Half a block to the subway and the Port Authority is right across the street which offers bus services to the airport, shopping for groceries, cash machines, etc... You can literally get anything you need within 2 blocks of the hotel and Times Square is only four blocks away. The Metro station is big and can pretty much get you on a train to wherever you are going. 2) Hotel is new, clean and quite (my room was on the opposite side of 40th avenue). Not spacious, but good for NYC. Internet access had reasonable performance. Maid service was good and the bathroom was shiny new. 3) Staff were friendly and courteous. Cons: 1) There are only 3 elevators and one of them is taken by the cleaning staff in the mornings so I had to wait up to 5 minutes a few times. 2) The breakfast buffet was crowded with tourist groups (mostly European) in the morning and the staff did not keep up with the coffee supply so a few times I had to go across the street to Starbucks. I was there for a week on leisure and found it to be an excellent choice at a reasonable price for NYC (I was able to use a corporate rate because I travel on business and use Marriott on occasion), NYC is an incredible city. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: ickle_ems
Reviews.Content: We have just returned froma 6 night stay at the Fairfield Inn and I felt I had to write a review after having had such a fantastic time. We flew into Newark and had already organised a shuttle transfer to the hotel through Super Shuttle (£25 each)... although handy, it took a long time, dropping off at other hotels and taking different routes (so about 90 minutes in the end!) I'd recommend the Newark airport express bus that travels to the Port Authority Bus Station opposit the hotel. We did this on the way back and it cos $15 each (about £10) Check in at the hotel was simple and the staff were incredibly friendly, providing us with a concierge map (that proved invaluable) and drawing on our location compared to places to eat and things to see etc. Our room was on the 13th floor at the front of the building and the only negative was that it was a bit noisy from the traffic below and in front (we were next to the exit of the bus station and building work was going on). If the room had been on the back of the hotel, or higher it would have been quiter. I didn't really have a problem, but my partner who is a light sleeper did struggle to sleep well. Aside from that everything else about the hotel was great. The room was large by NY standards with a king sized bed (with memory foam matresses) desk, 37" LCD TV with many channels, coffee maker, heating/airconditioning unit, hairdryer, alarm clock, plenty of storage space and a lovely, stylish en-suite bathroom. The bed was made daily (unless you laid a card on the bed) and towels were replaced daily if you left them on the floor/in the bath (an energy saving policy). The complimentray breakfast started from 7am on weekends and 6.30am weekdays and consisted of bagels, muffins, pastries, fruit, cereal and yoghurts. However, if you got there a bit late it was very busy and tables were all taken but you can eat in the lobby where there are breakfast bars and comfy chairs. There were 3 computers with internet access linked to a printer in the lobby. We found this useful for planning places to go, checking in for our flights online and printing our boarding passes. A concierge was also available in the lobby to give advise/directions or book tickets/tables etc. The staff were all really helpful and approachable. The location of the hotel is great, despite being next to a Parole office... do not let that put you off though, its a really safe area, well lit and always busy. The hotel is only a few blocks from Times Square and Broadway and right next to 9th avenue (Hell's Kitchen) which offered an unending variety of places to eat... we had Thai and Mexican. My partner is vegetarian and he also had a wide variety of choices wherever we ate. Most of the other midtown things to see were within 15 minutes walk e.g. Empire State, Javits Centre, Rockefeller Plaza, Macy's, 5th Avenue shops, Madison Square Garden etc. Central Park took about 30 minutes (although this was also due to the many traffic lights you have to stop at at each block) There are several subway stops nearby (the closest at Port Authority) and I really would recommend taking the subway if your feet get tired. Its really clean, not that busy and fully air-conditioned... very different to the London Tube! We took the subway from Penn Station a few blocks down all the way to the Staten Island Ferry Terminal - it took about 10 minutes! You can purchase a 4 trip subway pass for $8, an unlimited day pass for $8.25 or and unlimited week pass for $27... well worth the money if you're going to be travelling around a lot! A couple of blocks up from the hotel along 8th Avenue is the Gray Line bus tour company (you see their reps on corners with Red (not yellow) jackets) You can purchase open top bus tours from them fo $44 for one tour or $54 for all their tours (downtown, uptown, brooklyn and night tours)... this is valid for 48 hours and are hop on, hop off. They were a great way to sight-see and give our feet a rest after we'd walked miles the first day! They also do more expensive offers that are valid for longer and include entrance to many attractions. When we returned to the hotel in the afternoons there was free hot chocolate and coffee facilities in the lobby, which was a really nice touch. The hotel is currently renovating the top floor of the building into a skybar with panoramic views and should be ready by the summer. Check out is 12pm and our flight wasn't until 8pm but the hotel does have a secure luggage storage room which we found really useful. Anyway, all in all, the holiday was amazing, the hotel was fab and if we go back we would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms, fab breakfasts, great value!”
Reviews.Author: LaceyPontypridd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Fairfield Inn. Hotel was very busy, as to be expected at Easter. Our room wasn't ready until nearly 5.30pm, but we were able to leave our bags, and had a room to shower in while waiting for our rooms. Had rooms on 25th floor, 2507 & 2508, with a view of the Empire State Building, which was great. Rooms were as described, our room 2507 had a lovely walk in shower, and room 2508 had a bath with overhead shower. Rooms were lovely and clean, with large beds, flatscreen tv, coffee-pod machine, iron and board, hairdryer, air-con etc. No complaints. No noise from other guests, just the usual air-con machine and the outside noise. You had to get up early for breakfast, as there are limited tables, but as you are in New York, this is a must anyway. Breakfasts filled you up, and were great considering that they were free.
