There is also a coffee on tap in the lobby area, and 3 free pc's. Free internet access in the rooms, via a cable, and easy to use. Staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. My only "wish" would have been able to stay in the room longer, as we didn't get in when expected, and it would have been appreciated to have that time at the end of our stay as our flight wasn't until 9pm. We would have been charged $159 dollars to stay for an extra 5 hours, which I thought was expensive. All in all, a great location (don't listen to other comments, as you are only a minute walk from a main street, and nothing gave us any cause for concern), rooms are great, and more modern than others we have stayed in.Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast and amenities are great. Ask for a taxi return to the airport (we went to Newark), and it was 30 minutes early, and a massive big car! I would definitely go again, but maybe not at Easter time, as it was SO busy everywhere. I have been 5 times, and this was the busiest. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: sbogner
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went for a girls getaway and was very pleased with this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The service overall was great! I had read other reviews about the location being "shady" which I don't believe to be true. I felt very safe walking freely around this hotel and entire times square area. We are from the midwest and never at all felt scared or in danger in this area. I would feel fine bringing my children to stay here, and this is coming from a protective mother. For great Italian food nearby, try Don Giavonni's. I am still dreaming about their food! Yummy!

Reviews.Title: “great for price!”
Reviews.Author: workaholic_at_play
Reviews.Content: except for the construction (but of course), this hotel was wonderful - from the service at the front desk to the nicely laid out breakfast each morning! the location was very convenient to each place we wanted to be near - the javitz center and times square! i would stay here again!! keep those rates low! thanks marriot!

Reviews.Title: “A new comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: musicalclara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the 11th floor in a room with a king-size bed. Our view was of an office building. We took the airport bus to and from JFK (It stops on 42nd street, just on the other side of Port Authority. I guess it's about 2 blocks from the hotel. The room was new, comfortable, clean and fairly roomy for NYC. There was a wardrobe for hanging clothes, a safe, an iron/board and a blow dryer. Very minor negatives: The knobs on the dresser drawers and nightside tables are more stylish than functional. The square sink in the bathroom is also more stylish than functional (the water just doesn't swirl right and doesn't wash away toothpaste properly). There was a lack of counter space in the bathroom. Everything else was positive. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast provided lots of choice. There was free wired internet in the room. Coffee was available in the lobby, all day, I think. Theatres were within walking distance with the closest one being about 3 minutes away. The hotel isn't right in the centre of Times Square but it's very close, on a relatively quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,walking distance to main things...”
Reviews.Author: paulaAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the central location in Nyc. The hotel is good, beds are fine, we had a room for 4 persons, not very large but good. Breakfast is fine, only sometimes you have to wait for a table 5 min when it is crowdy in the hotel. Its clean, new, and you can walk to many famous places, only 5 min walk to Times Square! Subway is 50 meters, busstation around the corner, shops everywhere around. There are only a few woman clubs in the same street but we thought its is no problem. It was possible to store our bags after check out, no charge, excellent, also the workers at the reception were helpfull and kind. Taxi to airport was 75 dollar. We recommend this hotel for sure! Price was included all taxes around 230 dollar per night/4 person room. Take a show on Broadway, this hotel is in the Theatre District, buy yout tickets on Pier 17, for good bargain on shows for same day or next! Next time we want to come again in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend - central location and comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: gemzglitz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2010 with my Mum and we were a tad concerned by some of the reviews. We were therefore pleasantly surprised with the hotel. We were on the 18th floor and the room was lovely and clean and the beds very comfy. The breakfast room was busy but we could always get a table. The selection was good for us (cereal, toast, bagel, yoghurt etc) We had no problems walking down the street and in fact walked room after midnight one night with zero problem. The street is busy so we never felt isolated . It's great for walking down to Times Square and we would go back in an instant. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not sure about location”
Reviews.Author: jb190281
Reviews.Content: Ive just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel, and all in all, cant complain. From arrival at the hotel, the staff were all very friendly, very helpful and knowledgable if theres anything you need. Never had to wait to speak to reception staff despite it being a small area. We were given a choice of room and we opted for one on the 25th floor. The view was great! We were booked to a room with just 1 double bed so the room wasnt massive but certainly big enough for us. This was the 3rd hotel Ive stayed at in NY and this room was the biggest of the 3 hotels. The room has all the usual (wardrobe, iron, press, hairdryer, tv, coffee), and was very clean. Complimentary toiletries in the bathroom were a nice touch. The breakfast was a pleasant surprise. Plenty of choice - about 5 cereals inc porridge, bread and bagels (option to toast), fresh fruit, yogurts, pastries, egg and bacon muffins as well as sweet muffins. All this including orange, cranberry or apple juice, water, or teas and coffee - all in all, Id say this was a good selection for a complimentary breakfast - something not many hotels offer. Breakfast area wasnt a large area but never had to wait for a table. Theres also a vending machine area on the lower ground floor - just $1 or $2 for bottled drinks and snacks, and theres also an ice machine. As for restaurants, nothing on site but there was one next door. Other restaurants are within walking distance, and Times Square not far. The location of the hotel isnt great - the street does include the parole board and x rated dvd shops - but we never felt uncomfortable. As someone previously mentioned, there was quite a police presence at the end of the street. Port Authority at the end of the street, great if you want to catch a bus or a taxi. Only a short walk to Times Square, but not "just off" Times Square as the name may suggest. Again, staff were extremely helpful when we needed to book out and store our luggage for the day. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Would definitely stay again at this hotel and I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: sha-7
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the marriot but this is not your usual marriott. It's a cheaper version. Booked 5 nights for 3 people. Pro: price, clean ( but this hotel is new and wear and tear changes are starting to show), close to port authority / 9th Av for restaurants. Cons: the rooms are tiny. There is barely enough room to open your suitcase. The bed and pillows are not the usual marriot ones. Step down in quality. Breakfast is very basic - toast, bagels, cereal, and a egg/ sausage roll - like what you would get at McDonalds. Polystyrene plates etc. Coffee and tea is awful, The free internet service is intermittent - often down and the printer has not worked for weeks. They agreed to book at taxi back to the hotel for 4pm and rang me at 4am instead! Then once we had left the hotel the taxi driver bumped up the price of the trip by 20$! There is a lot of contruction work going on so looks tacky and it is next to a few adult video stores - which generally did not get in our way. No restaurants on site. I looked at staying at the marriot times square which would have been a bit more and regret not booking elsewhere. If on a budget and you want a clean place to put your head down at night - this hotel is fine. If you want to relax in your room and enjoy your stay this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: NorthEndBos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my partner. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was plentiful, room was extremely clean (yet tight) and you can't beat the location. The street is under construction which makes it seem a little less desirable. We did not feel unsafe there at all (and even walked home at 1am). Only complaint was the bathroom vent seemed to take amplify the wind (presumably from the shaft) being so high up (28th floor). When we shut the door, couldn't hear it anymore. Would definately stay again and recommend. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Other reviews have it on the mark”
Reviews.Author: itbetterbeclean
Reviews.Content: Its true, being midblock on 40th St. next to Port Authority is seedy, I don't think my wife would stay here alone, but if you're traveling on business you can't beat the rate, with huge free breakfast, comfortable bed and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Marriott in Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: travellingconsultant
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work (about 45 weeks out of the year) and try to stay at Marriott's whenever possible. Usually the Marriott's in Manhattan are out of my company budget price range, but was able to book several weeks at Fairfield Inn for < $200 a night. This is a new hotel, with free breakfast, and nice new rooms of decent size for Manhattan. Gym is also not too bad by Manhattan standards. The location is not great as other people said in past reviews as it is a bit sketchy street with porn shops and next to bus terminal, and as I'm in NYC a lot Times Square is not a great place to be. But if you can get this hotel for < $200 I would definitely recommend it, especially if you like the Marriott points like me.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in a Fabulous Location for Exploring the City”
Reviews.Author: brownbearLeeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend over Halloween weekend in 2009. We took a cab from the airport and got dropped right outside the hotel which was great. Check in was quick and went very smoothly. Our room was situated on the 27th floor (probably not great for those with vertigo) and we had an amazing view of the Empire State Building from our room. The room was quite small however had all the usual things... gorgeous big Marriott bed, wardrobe, desk, chair etc. All the fixtures and fittings were modern and looked like new (this hotel only opened in 2009 apparently). The bathroom again was quite bijou however a nice big shower, basin and bowl. Breakfast was the usual Marriott fayre with muffins, pastries, bagels, fruit, yoghurt etc all included. If you're a fan of Krispy Kreme donuts you're in for a treat as fresh ones were available every morning. The room where breakfast was served was quite dark (seemed as though it was underground!!!) and did get quite busy, however we always managed to get a table. The hotel was in an excellent location, literally five minutes walk from Times Square. Some people have commented on here that the road where the hotel is situated is a little scary, however we never had any problems, and due to it being right next to the bus terminal, there was always a lot of traffic and cabs etc passing by. The hotel reception staff were great and always happy to help. If I ever go back to NYC, I would definately stay here as it was cheap and cheerful!

Reviews.Title: “A really good stay !”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderBorges
Reviews.Content: We went to Fairfield Inn by Marriot whith an expectation, but our stay was much better ! There are excelent services, free breakfast, free business center and free coffe, milk and chocolat ao day and night long. The flat was another think very nice. Whith LCD TV, coffe, good structure and the most important, a big and confortable bed ! To complete, It's possible to get a newspaper for free every morning !The location is not so good but even it's so close to Times Square ! Go there and enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NayaliaMSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in that hotel in January 2010 for 7 nights. First of all I’d like to mention staff of a hotel – all persons with who I communicated were nice and friendly and always tried to help in all my questions. We checked in very quickly in the room we have asked in our preferences – it was 1 King on the high floor. There are 8 rooms on the floor. Our room was not near the elevator and it was good, cause when our neighbour left his room we heard it. Noise insulation is not good enough. The room itself was very nice – good size, handy furniture, everything is new and clean. Very comfortable bed. The same I can say and about the bathroom. Housekeeping was at high level, every day without misses. We had a free wired internet in the room which was very convenient. At lobby they have free wireless internet and 3 computers. Breakfast was good. In other reviews there was listed what they offer so I won’t repeat that. Only I want to say that we always found the vacant seat to have a breakfast and there were no problems with that. The location of the hotel is very good – 2 blocks from Time Square, with metro station in 50 meters and with a number of nice restaurants in neighbourhood. Yes there is bus terminal in front of the hotel, but ask for room at high floor and you won’t see and hear it. The only things which can annoy are construction and the scaffold near the hotel. In addition the hotel has jym at the ground floor and in the nearest future they plan to open bar at the highest floor which should have excellent Manhattan view. As a whole I highly recommend that hotel to everybody. Ratio between price/quality is optimal.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamster_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed just before christmas with six relatives who were all over the age of sixty. The staff in the hotel were extremely helpful and friendly. The concierge recommended and booked restaurants for our stay which saved masses of time. The hotel bedrooms were very large with a massive king size bed. We had booked a king size deluxe room which was spolessly clean. The breakfasts are self service but more than aqequate with porridge, toasted muffins and bagels,cereal and yoghurts and juices and coffee. Coffee is served all day and at night time there are cookies. There is no bar at the hotel but there is a cracking irish bar two streets away on 44th street and 8th Avenue which is cosy and friendly and cheap. The hotel is not located in the nicest of areas but is in a cracking spot to see the sights and is two blocks from Time Square. The area looks worse than it is with a couple of seedy shops nearby and at night time doesn't look great but we ventured out at night and had no problems what so ever with anything or anyone. You onle have to walk fifty metres and you are on thr main drag. Some of the reviews for the location put me off a little but on going there I have no concerns. It is a great hotel, great service and great location and my family and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very good, neighborhood questionable”
Reviews.Author: asrosen
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, excellent service. Free breakfast is good but it can get frantic given the number of people in a relatively small space. Rooms are quite nice, with a somewhat edgy design, though on the smaller side. While its location is convenient (right next to Port Authority), it's not the best of neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Meet our expectations- safe, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LesSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: In NYC for Thanksgiving parade, etc. with family of 12 that includes four children ages 6-10. Hotel opened in early 2009 and is new. Hotel has 8 rooms per floor; four of the rooms face 40th Street while the other four rooms are on the back of the hotel. We had four rooms on the 27th floor. Two faced 40th Street while the other two rooms are on the back of the hotel and are quieter. Suggest you request rooms on back of hotel and higher floor for quietness. Rooms size is fine, clean with comfortable bed and pillows. Hotel has three elevators and even though the hotel was full the wait for an elevator was not long. Free breakfast was fine (coffee, hot chocolate, juice, fruit, cereal, toast, bagales, muffins, and biscuits with egg and meat). The free breakfast is nice benefit especially when you have kids. Breakfast room size is fine. 40th street is not the nicest but we always felt safe with our kids and never had a problem. There is a subway stop (40th Street and 8th Av.) within 150 feet of the hotel; you can also walk underground from this subway stop to the Times Square station which is great. The hotel is next to a Sheraton Four Points, and a new hotel is being built on the other side the Fairfield Inn. The hotel is across the street from a major bus terminal and it is easy to get a cab. We were there for 5 nights, our stay was fine, and we had no problems with this hotel. The hotel is fine for a family who wants to bring kids to NYC. It is safe, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarahandoscarparedes
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Everything was brand new and super clean! Free breakfast in the morning with a really nice modern sitting/eating area and vast assortment of different foods. The King size bed was very comforatable and had 4 really soft pillows. The bath room was huge and had a walk in shower. I will deff. want to stay here again! Great location and great price with name your own price on priceline ($85 woo hooo!). We were able to leave our bags after check out in the morning to shop or whatever untill we were ready to leave the city so that was a great help too!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott quality but dreary location.”
Reviews.Author: LaloPeru
Reviews.Content: A typical Marriott hotel...attentive staff, great, clean rooms. You feel welcomed and at home, BUT...the location, next to the bus station, is horrible. Porno shops right next to the hotel. Guess it will change soon, as all that area is being renewed, but for the time being you should be aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: scotteatsworld
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn in October for 5 nights. The hotel was only 7 months old and was very nice indeed. We had a double room with free safe, wired high speed internet access, 32" plasma television with HD channels and Air conditioning. The room was clean and had an excellent view. Our package included the continental breakfast which was perfect but the tabled seating area was not huge as we had to wait when it was busy. The staff were very helpful and polite. The location was perfect as it was only 4 blocks from times square and the port authority bus terminal with subway station, perfect if you take the AirTrain from JFK, just take the C or A train from Howard beach. The staff said that there will be a bar and restaurant coming soon. All in all it was excellent hotel and I will be going back there!!

Reviews.Title: “great ny value”
Reviews.Author: goblue59
Reviews.Content: this is a new property that is a great ny value. the rooms are typically ny small but nicely decorted and furnished. the staff is exceptional. a good ny value. would stay here again. only downside is difficulty getting a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel shame about the place :-)”
Reviews.Author: aeonf242
Reviews.Content: A very smart mid range Hotel, looks fairly new, tall builidng, 8 rooms per floor. Free breakfast which provides ample self service food of OK standard. Friendly staff. No bar or restaurant at the hotel which is a shame. Good location in general just opposite the Port Authority Bus Terminal and very close to the Underground exit. One thing that might let it down for some people are it's neighbours, it's on the same street as the probation service and several adult book stores. Having said that aslong as you're not a prude then this shouldn't be an issue. The location in itself is great for walking to the sights, 5th Avenue, Time Square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great service, convinient if you get a good price..”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy7
Reviews.Content: Before we even stayed there, I had a good idea of what the property was going to be like. It is located right next door to the Four Points (basically, attached to each other) and so I figured it would be similar. It is. Lobby is functional, if just a bit small. Room off to the side with computers is very helpful if you don't have your own though there are always people on them. Rooms are small - smallest I've seen in New York I believe. There were 3 of us, and with all our suitcases I found it a bit cramped. While we never really 'fell over' each other, it was hard to get organized in the morning with all 3 of us in the room. Therefore, we went down for breakfast in turns so there was more room to get ready in. Our room contained 2 double beds, the bathroom, a TV cabinet/closet and a desk. Well laid out for the size, just very tiny. Breakfast was a great addition with many items to enjoy. Cereal, baked goods, heated sandwiches, coffee/tea/juice, fruit and yogurt. Breakfast room could be busy at times, though we never had a problem finding a table. One thing to note, however, was the wait for the elevators during breakfast hours. Sometimes it took up to 10 minutes for one to arrive either on your floor, or in the lobby. One huge mention goes out to the staff - all front office staff were very friendly. Always said hello to us, and remembered who we were throughout our stay. Very helpful, and that is a good find in New York. Another positive mention goes out to the free internet in the rooms. The hotel is located on 40th street, bordering the south side of the Port Authority Bus Station. It is a fairly desolate street with adult video stores, a liquor store and a corrections office located on it. I never felt unsafe on it, though my mother remarked she would probably never walk down the street alone at night. Subway entrance, when open, is located at the corner of 40th and 8th Avenue. Overall, a nice hotel in a bit of a down area. Good value for the money, though not incredibly cheap. To be honest, some of Marriott's other properties in Times Square were available for only a fraction more, though if you want free breakfast/internet..you will only find it here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in NYC Midtown Area”
Reviews.Author: lavender11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay in this hotel. Paid $100 per night (+ tax and fees) via Priceline - great deal! Front desk gave us a high-floor king-size room (some hotels would give bad rooms to Priceline booking). Room is small but new, modern, and clean. Free breakfast buffet. Excellent service. Convenient location - a few blocks' walk to Times Square and half a block to metro entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!!!”
Reviews.Author: rhea98
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fairfield Inn for 5 days with my oldest friend - a great reuniion. She booked the Hotel, living in California, me being from England. Initial thoughts, the Hotel was in a busy sidestreet and quite small. However the room, although compact and bijou, fulfilled our every requirement. Lovely comfortable beds, good bath/shower, clean linen daily. Very good breakfasts and quite local to Times Square, Metro and bus station. Very convenient for everything we needed. I have only 1 gripe, about NYC and that is that I never had a warm drink in a proper cup/mug. All drinks were offered in either plastic of cardboard cups. Guess if that's my only gripe I have nothing to complain about. Loved the City, the people, even got used to the frenetic pace and the thousands of tourists, mostly walking in the opposite direction to me!!!

Reviews.Title: “a GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stevemetsfan
Reviews.Content: New hotel, great location, great rate... Clean, safe, helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and easy access to all New York attractions”
Reviews.Author: VWCalgary
Reviews.Content: Fairfield Inn by Marriott is a good choice for any travellers. They are always clean, cosy and affordable.The Fairfield Inn in Manhattan/Time Squares is no exception. I enjoyed my stay tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business trips - better breakfast would earn it an "Excellent" rating”
Reviews.Author: slowlyraoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on business. Yes, this part of 40th St is not very welcoming perhaps, but I didn't feel unsafe at any time. It's close to the subway, it's got great food options within walking distance, it's clean, modern and comfortable. I had a rate of only $125 per night so in that class it's really great; if there had been just a few more fresh items on offer in the complimentary breakfast, I would have rated it excellent. Free internet is of course a major plus as well. Two points of criticism only: issues with the elevators (waiting for 4 minutes on the 20th floor is not fun), and if they'd have even just one small meeting room available it would be better for business. Overall though, I will check their rates again when I am coming back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, dirty area”
Reviews.Author: jgordon24
Reviews.Content: I am partial to Marriott properties as a result of positive experiences so we chose this one due to the rate being $189/night on Labor Day weekend. The property itself is very nice but tight... the lobby is tight, the breakfast area is tight, elevators tight., the hallways tight.... we only had 2 small bags with us... I couldn't imagine getting on the elevator with larger pieces of luggage... having said this, while the king size room was small and.... you got it... tight, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast is nothing special.. some instant hot cereal, cold cerea, apples and bananas each day, breakfast sandwiches for microwaving, standard breads with toaster... we always got a seat... sometimes had to wait but no big deal.... it would be nice if there were windows in the breakfast area... it appears that they might be working on this...I believe that there were 3 computers in the lobby area with free internet access and printing capabilities... It was nice having Pantene shampoo, conditioner and lotion. There is a nice hairdryer provided so don't bring one unless you are particular. Our view was of an office building but we didn't spend too much time in the room. If you plan to eat food in the room, this isn't the room for you... all we had was a king size bed and a chair with a desk... there was no other place to sit or an additional small table. There was enough room for our clothes for 4 days. The area is not the best.. while you are a few blocks from Times Square and the subway, you must walk by stores advertising peep show booths (even for buddies!!) and erotic merchandise/dvds etc.... there were always a few guys loitering about and police presence..the Port Authority is across the street..... if you walk 2 blocks to 7th street, the are changes dramatically. I would stay here again if the price is right; otherwise I preferred the Residence Inn on 6th Ave. Note that there are also 2 Courtyards on 42nd - one near 6th; the other near 5th.... the taxi driver did not believe us when we said that there was a hotel here.. it's THAT new. If you're going to Yankee stadium like we did, you can walk to Bryant Park station (at 6th and 42nd) and take the D train.... remember, NYC is a walking city.... what a place!! Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Brand New”
Reviews.Author: jette281
Reviews.Content: I booked a top floor King Suite at $369 for a night. They call it a "penthouse suite," but it's really just a somewhat larger room with a sitting area. The hotel is newly built so the room was very clean and polished. There was a desk, a mini fridge, two very nice plasma TVs, and a large bathroom. The hotel is located on a pretty quiet side street where there was still a lot of construction, but it didn't seem like an unsafe area to me at all. The top floor has wonderful views, but I thought the windows were rather small. The lobby was also very small and the hallways were narrow. However, there was a large breakfast room that was uniquely decorated. The hotel is about a mile from Grand Central. It's close enough to walk, but if you have luggage or something taking a cab might be better. Overall, a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a good location”
Reviews.Author: BillCt
Reviews.Content: Had to find a hotel at the last minute for an overnight stay in NYC. After checking on line for a number of days & seeing either crazy prices or out of the way locations, this property showed up & at a great price for midtown NYC. I was nor disappointed as the rooms were clean, good size & fast check-in. On the down side, street wasn't the best & seemed like it took forever for the elevators to show up & when they did packed already with guests. But overall I'd stay there again as location & price well made up for any minor short comings.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and staff are great, hope the street changes its crowd”
Reviews.Author: Aquasolaris
Reviews.Content: This is a big room for NYC standards, specially where they have the king beds. I know the rest of the USA has huge rooms, but this is as big as the (newer) budget hotels are going to get. It was comfortable, nice flatscreen, and bathroom was also bigger than expected. Yes the street is creepy, but just keep a brisk walk and you'll be fine. This complex is actually brand spanking new, and a similar hotel is about to open its doors next door in a couple of months time. Then there will be three hotel towers on the street. So when the scaffolding will be gone, and there will be a lot more foottraffic moving along, that should take away more of the creeps. Although I saw a lot of cops on the streets, so until then you'll be fine too. Do yourself a favor and turn north on Ninth Ave, there are great restaurants a couple of short blocks up, and restaurant row isn't that good compared what they have going on upwards of 43rd and 9th! For the gay travelers, this is also a gayfriendly neighborhood. Jammed between 8th and 9th av (and 43rd and 57th street), try Therapy, nice place for drinks. And non-gays, it is not going to scare you away, its just guys and girls having fun, but not in a leather/non clothing, don't want to confront your kids and grandma kind of way, so at least enjoy the cuisine! I did see a lot of family's trying to get into the restaurants, but as they have a lot of 2 person tables, you might want to reserve so you don't miss your show. Ask for a high floor, and you'll have great view of the cityscape, nothing facy though, just tall buildings! Elevators are quite quick, as there are three. I've been in 30 floor 10 room a floor, buildings with 2 slower ones than these, so this is again as good as it gets. Just plan for the breakfast rush, then it might take 5 mins max. Staff are either trained well, or non-New Yorkers, they laugh, and look you in the eye while checking in! So all in all, this is a great hotel, in a great location, 2 short blocks to 42nd, and a long block to times sq (7th), subway (huge 42nd street subway interconnect station) at the end of the street, across from port authority busterminal (take the bus from Newark airport, and it will drop you of at 42nd and 8th, 2 short blocks from the hotel, and pick up is at 41st, so only one short block!).

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel at 1 star price”
Reviews.Author: imatractor
Reviews.Content: I got a great senior rate for a comfortable king bed room with a nice view. The complimentary breakfast had great selections. The Hotel is new. The staff is helpful and courteous. The location, across from Port Authority and walking distance to Times Square, is perfect. The area around the hotel is a bit rundown, but did not appear dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Inn was nice, clean, friendly and economical.”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaAngler4life
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with friends while visiting New York City for the weekend. We needed to stay somewhere economical and this was the best value for our money. The rooms were small (hey its NY) but they were recently renovated and updated. The only things to mention would be that you have to wait sometimes for the elevators because they are not split between floors and the atmosphere outside the hotel. There are still renovations going on so scaffolds are up and its not the best scene at night. Other than that you are seconds away from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights and was highly pleased! I looked for a low cost hotel in Manhattan for a trip that I was attempting to do at as low cost as possible. I found an AAA rate of $119 per night for this property on the hotel website. The location was wonderful even though it looks out on the gigantic and ugly Port Authority Building and when turning left from the front door one encounters some less than lovely areas. However, if you make a right you are just a short block away from the hub-bub of Times Square. You do have to walk by an adult bookstore but as a solo female traveler I was not at all intimidated or bothered by anyone on the street and I was in and out at all hours with no problems.Go up a few blocks and turn left and you are in the Hell's Kitchen area where every type of dining experience awaits. I would not go into this area by turning left from the hotel only because you must walk under an underpass area by the Port Authority and a large crowd of men hang out in this area. I felt uncomfortable the one time I did try this route so I just walked right and up a block and then to the left from then on. Go into the Port Authority building and downstairs to the Subway -- so convenient!! The hotel room itself was small as NYC hotels are prone to be, but the space was well-designed. I would have liked another shelf in the bathroom--the very deep sink has no lip or shelf around it to speak of so storing my toiletries was a bit of a pain. There was no tub but the glass-doored shower had great water pressure and the door made the space seem larger than it was. The bed was comfortable. The view from the window was not wonderful but I could see the lights of the New Yorker building in the evening as well as the spire of the Empire State Building so it was not the worst view I have ever had out of a New York hotel. I could see blue sky and tried not to see into the windows of the nearby apartment building, but all in all I was happy. The folks at the hotel were great. One staffer would push the elevator button when she saw me coming in and often ask how my day had gone. the concierge found a great seat for me at Hair when I grew weary of standing in the half price line for tickets one day. Several times I asked them to make change for me which they did readily at the front desk and they were always cheerful. One day I needed utensils for take-out I had picked up and a staff person went in the back and came back with plastic forks, spoons, and knives. I was just so pleased by the caring attitude of the people at the hotel. They delivered a fridge to my room so i was able to buy take-out and food from markets and eat in when I chose. I did have a problem with other guests who allowed their children to spend great lengths of time on the lobby computers. These kids would be playing games when I needed to print my boarding passes and I think a sign that says please limit your usage of computers in consideration of other guests or something would help. There were two machines and one night a teenager was instant messaging her friends for more than an hour and I finally asked her if I could please have the computer just to check the schedule of one event and then i would return it to her. She grudgingly agreed. On the night I needed to print the pass i did not think the parents of the kids would ever allow me a turn, but they finally did leave with their kids in tow. I would definitely stay here again. The location is great. it is on a quiet street and there is little noise on the backside of the hotel. The rooms have nice flat panel TVs with premium channels, comfortable beds, and are very clean. There is a small wardrobe in the room--no closets and the dresser area has drawers to store clothes--there is free internet in the rooms and good lighting. The only thing I missed was the lack of room service but there was one menu of a nearby place that delivers and a list of places nearby that offered delivery so in a pinch that would do. Do try the ethnic places in hell's kitchen. I plan to write reviews of many of them when I get time as I had some great dining experiences at very low cost. The entire trip was just under a thousand dollars and it included multiple plays, transportation, great food and lodging for five days so I met my goal of biting off the Big Apple without breaking the bank!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilantlv
Reviews.Content: Overall I was pleasantly surprised from the hotel and it did not differ much from his more upscale sibling - the courtyard. Location is good, just near port authority which nowadays luckily is safe and secure 24\7. I wouldnt though call it a Times Square locations, since it's 4-5 blocks away. Rooms are not big but adequate and very well equiped and maintained, though windows are a bit too small, at least in our room. The shower was great! complimentary breakfast is also very nice and handy for starting off the hotel (40th) - hopefully it's not a permanant problem. the day. During our last night there was non stop noise from road work on the street in front of Another advantage of the hotel is the relative cheap parking it offers on a parking lot just next door - 25$ and for those arriving with a car to NYC it's a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: karenhvb
Reviews.Content: At $169/night, this was a steal. On a grotty street, but just blocks away from theaters, restaurants, etc. Rooms are modern and adequate, though bathrooms could be better-designed. Excellent service. Amazingly good free continental breakfast, though they could lay on more seating & tables.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: loftiseventplanner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I have a sister who works for Marriotts which gave be an awesome rate! I knew what to expect from a limited service hotel before I got there but was pleasantly surprised. The rooms looked very nice. This hotel is brand new like it just opened so everything was nice. The breakfast was a little better than I expected. This is the place to go if you are traveling on a budget but want something decent especially if you are sightseeing and you only need rooms to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in the heart of NYC.”
Reviews.Author: bigteacher
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel, centrally located, that offers great value. The rooms are decent sized for Manhattan with full baths. They are pleasantly appointed with attractive furniture, flat screen TVs and and coffee makers. Throw in free breakfast and and free internet, and you have a gem of a deal for $170. You can pay far more and get much less in Manhattan. The only negative is that the street is a little gritty, but that's New York, and you're quickly beyond it. This is a great place to further explore NYC or to go to shows on Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for mid-town Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: KenCarpenter
Reviews.Content: My wife travels a bit for business and swears by the Marriott chain. This Fairfield Inn did not disappoint us. It is modern, clean and very convenient to all the attractions of mid-town Manhattan. (Its location opposite the imposing wall of the Port Authority was not the most scenic stretch of street, but it was clean and felt safe. One block west of 8th Avenue.) Our king room was snug, but plenty big enough for two people and five suitcases (long trip). Very nice furnishings, nice bathroom with a blaster showerhead, a safe in the tall wardrobe, plenty of drawers, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, flat-screen TV, free wireless and wired Internet, etc. Our rate was $179, including breakfast, which is higher than Fairfields in general but very good for NYC. Standard cold breakfast items, with microwavable Jimmy Dean ham-and-egg muffins (I loved them!). Parking garage was adjacent -- posted rate was $25 for 24 hours, but the attendant said there is a discount if you get your ticket stamped by the hotel staff. I will find out what it is when I check out. While it pains me to spend more than $100 a night for any hotel -- if it was a little less expensive, I would have given it five starts -- I feel that this property is an outstanding value in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “This new hotel is attractive and clean, but the air conditioner drove me crazy.”
Reviews.Author: ScarletG
Reviews.Content: Well located a few blocks south of the Times Square hullabaloo, this reasonably priced hotel has lots to offer, as noted by other reviewers. Beds and pillows are extremely comfortable, the room and bathroom are small but adequate and clean, and the staff is quite friendly and accommodating. However, there are a few drawbacks. The adequate breakfast could be greatly enhanced by the addition of fruit other than apples and bananas. Towels are so thin they barely dry. Worst of all is the room (not central) air conditioner, which cycles on and off with great noise, awakening me several times each night and requiring frequent volume adjustment of the TV volume. When the cooler cycles off, the fan goes off as well, causing an uncomfortable stillness. I inquired but received no response.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Conveniently Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masson61
Reviews.Content: Stayed there June 20 - 23. Most of the reviews I read before I booked this hotel are accurate - Nice hotel situated on a not so nice street. However, we were never bothered by anyone, and 1/2 block in either direction and you're on 8th avenue in times square, or restaurant row on 9th avenue. Very close to the theaters, on and off Broadway. There were always police present on the corners, and I never saw any disturbances take place. The room was nice and very clean. Smaller than you would have in probably any other location in the world, but not too small for comfort. The staff was nice and welcoming. Appreciated the complimentary continental breakfast every morning. It was an enjoyable stay. If you want to get the nicest hotel room for the least amount of money - then this is the place.
